author: {'steamid': '76561198035459175', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1497749107}
review:
A fun, light-hearted game with a great concept. It's an easy game that can be a little frustrating at times. The visual design is great, the sound design is even better. 

Pros: Great soundtrack, visuals are great, easy to learn

Cons: A very easy game but can be very frustrating at times which leads me to my biggest issue of the game. Clunky controls, the responsiveness when clicking in directions takes a lot getting used to and the character doesn't seem to respond quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039405652', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1497471806}
review:
A fun short game where the funky and catchy music makes it all the more enjoyable. 

What I liked about the game was that although a level is about 30 minutes long, it is divided into 5 checkpoint sections. You start off swimming around as your main character, but every other checkpoint you get to swim with an awesome vehicle that shoots and automatically regenerates health. This change of pace every two checkpoints keeps the game from feeling samey. I actually enjoyed these sections the most.

Another great thing are the collectibles. In your adventures you collect crystals to unlock pictures about the development of the game. Normally I don't care much for concept art, but this game shows quirky pictures of the development team with funny captions and a bit of an insight in the development of the game. I really enjoyed these. 

I also really liked the hand-drawn art-style the game had to offer. However, at times it was a little bit hard to see if a section was actually passable or a wall. This is just a slight annoyance, but to me it was worth it for such a great style. 

My favourite thing however, has to be the music. Every time I finished a level, I thought to myself: let's play something else. That was until I heard the music of the next level and decided to stay and play another one. The catchy guitars, amazing singing and grooving beats kept me nodding with my head almost the entire playthrough. The fact that different creatures add different sounds to the music is an amazing touch. 

Negatives: At times, the control of the character felt a little bit too slow and unresponsive for me, especially when I used the "run" (or in the case of this game: swim faster) button. There weren't many spaces where I felt I could utilize this skill. However, when there are timers in the game, they are forgiving and you do not need precision swimming to get through most of the levels. The dash ability that you get usually gives you enough speed to make it to certain points in time, and the "run" skill is therefor not needed to finish the game. 

Another thing that bugged me was that sometimes it was unclear if a path was a secret path with gems or a path to the next goal. This sometimes led to points where I realised I missed a secret, but was unable to go back and get it. It felt unfair that I had seen the path, but that it locked me out of that path for taking the "wrong" route. I guess this adds replayability, but I don't care much for it.

Overall I would say it is worth playing even if for the music alone! If you like funky, groovy music mixed with a little techno, this game is for you. Also, if you like an easy-going, casual side-scroller where you can just enjoy the surroundings and play through without too much effort, you'll like this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025135104', 'num_games_owned': 3451, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1484972389}
review:
[h1]el oc√©ano se descubre al ritmo del bit[/h1]

Beatbuddy es uno de esos juegos que intimidan por la cantidad de menciones y premios que luego presumen en la portada. Respir√© profundamente y decid√≠ esperar lo mejor; estos juegos indie, algunas veces, se destacan por ser m√°s bonitos o aspirar a romper ciertos l√≠mites narrativos antes que‚Ä¶ no s√©, jugarse bien. No es el caso de Beatbuddy. Afortunadamente hay un juego s√≥lido e interesante detr√°s de la m√∫sica y de las gr√°ficas.

Supongo que el videojuego tambi√©n inspirado en Ecco (habr√≠a que estudiar cu√°ntos son hijos del delf√≠n) porque todo ocurre en el mar y en estas plataformas, en vez de correr, te toca nadar. Beatbuddy presenta la historia de unos esp√≠ritus acu√°ticos que son los guardianes de la m√∫sica y de alg√∫n oc√©ano. Tu papel es explorar varios mundos acu√°ticos al ritmo de m√∫sica electr√≥nica y en el camino recuperar alg√∫n artefacto para restaurar el balance. T√≠pico pero ching√≥n. La m√∫sica, como lo promete el juego, es sabros√≠sima y el progreso afecta su ritmo; surgen los instrumentos y su beat acelera conforme avanzas.

Las gr√°ficas tienen un estilo caricaturizado de alta resoluci√≥n y calidad. Cada escena (personaje, fondo y enemigos) parece una caricatura que ver√≠as en MTV de los ochenta (muy ad hoc con el tema musical del juego). Es muy guapo apreciar c√≥mo se mueven los villanos al ritmo de la m√∫sica, y ello parece una invitaci√≥n al jugador a incorporarse dentro del ritmo. Predomina cierta intenci√≥n de evitar a los enemigos, bailar con ellos, en vez de la destrucci√≥n (ojo: el juego s√≠ tiene sus pedazos de destrucci√≥n, aislados, pero los tiene). Beatbuddy tambi√©n consta de algunos acertijos de velocidad y movimiento los cu√°les, bueno, pueden tomar un par de intentos y podr√≠an interrumpir el flujo, pero nada grave.

¬øRecomiendo Beatbuddy? Sim√≥n, es un juego hermosamente detallado y su vida musical es pura gozadera. No tiene una gran historia, algunos di√°logos est√°n chafones, pero querr√°s explorar su fascinante mundo acu√°tico y sus escenarios estridentes.

==

Si gustas, puedes leer [url=http://www.agustinfest.com/tema/los-gustos/de-videojuegos/]m√°s rese√±as de videojuegos[/url] en mi p√°gina personal. O bien, √∫nete a mi [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/arbol1000]grupo de Steam[/url] donde aviso de estas rese√±as.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080798463', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1465781401}
review:
Beatbuddy kann ich nur eingeschr√§nkt empfehlen. Die Idee ist gro√üartig! Eine Welt, die aus Musik besteht und in der alles mit dieser Musik interagiert. Von der Bewegung der Figuren, bis zum l√∂sen von R√§tseln, alles ist rythmisch. Das Design der Spielwelt ist wundersch√∂n, vor allem die Hintergr√ºnde sind aufwendig gestalltet.
Doch das Spiel hat mit Schwierigkeiten zu k√§mpfen. Die Story ist √§u√üerst klischeehaft, die R√§tsel sind manchmal sehr simpel und manchmal frustrierend schwer. Vor allem die Tatsche, dass die Checkpoints unfair verteilt sind, und das Spiel schnell monoton wird, machen es schwer mit Beatbuddy √ºber l√§ngere Zeit Spa√ü zu haben.
Wer auf der Suche nach einem rythmischen Spiel f√ºr zwischendurch ist, wird mit Beatbuddy seinen Spa√ü haben. Wer aber motivierendes Gameplay sucht, wird hier entt√§uscht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054699161', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1488109631}
review:
Cute little game, with interesting game mechanic. It took me around 5-6 hours to finish first time.

Pros:
+ Everything moves according to music beats
+ Good soundtrack, which is extremely important for this type of game
+ Good graphics
+ Fluid commands

Cons:
- Simple, at times tedious, puzzles
- Becomes repetitive, needs better level design to keep ti fresh longer
- Anticlimactic ending

I would recommend this game, especially to some younger audience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078815095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1486445610}
review:
I prefer my rhythm games to involve a dance pad so I'll keep this short.

Visually its beautiful. Very much a fan of how it looks.
The music is nice, with an appropriate beat.

The mechanics are fairly straightforward and work well.

If you like rhythm games and appreciate good visuals, then this is worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059330591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1486229035}
review:
Really interesting "musical platformer" game.
The soundtrack is superb, the dialogues blend in perfectly with it (some of them are not words at all, but beatboxes that go along with the music).
Story is nice, simple and interesting, not pretentious at all (unlike some games that try too hard hard in this aspect and end up failing miserably).
Controls are good. On rare occasions t might be a bit difficult to execute some moves, but I found it so rare that I can never say the controls are bad. It plays well both on a keyboard+mouse and on a controller.
Graphics are gorgeous, really well done.
You can see the devs put their heart in this game, everything has that extra tounch on it, like the sounds, graphics and dialogues.

Overall I would give 9/10 to this game, mainly because of the soundtrack and sound effects.

Great game, please give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094033276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1484344946}
review:
Beatbuddy is a fun little puzzle game witha  rhythm element. Each of the 6 levels is <1 hour and so a good short experience - Can already see myself going back to this to 100% it and see if maybe there's a speedrtunning community for it.

For a game which is so music lead I personally loved the electronic music - especially worth the Sountrack purchase therefore! Very fun and a good example of an indie game worth a playthrough. I picked this up on sale (as I do most things) and whilst this isn't going to blow your mind - it's certainly a fun experience so worth a sale pick up if maybe not quite recommendable at full price. Despite being a good looking game the feel is very much like a retro game. Definitieyl worth a look if you're a puzzle or rhythm gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077796332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1483934665}
review: Cool game, but somehow still incredibly buggy after 3 years. Have gotten stuck and was forced to restart twice now because the bass stopped beating and all the objects in the level stopped working. I know that the purpose of a game is to waste time, but this is pushing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972266428', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1483600894}
review:
Beautiful game, Beatbuddy's animations are stellar, and the music is amazing.

Unfortunately, Beatbuddy's gameplay is not as great as its aesthetics. It felt like a chore to play. The puzzles were tedious and weren't mentally challenging at all; that's basically the majority of the game (from what I played). The controls on a gamepad are passable, but the movement is floaty and I never felt like I was in total control. The music aspect, while a fun concept, ultimately hindered movement (especially while in control of the submarine), and felt more like a gimmick more than anything else. Timing button presses to move to the beat was rewarding, but often times you went too fast for the camera to catch up, resulting in Beatbuddy hugging the edges of the screen constantly and being unable to see the dangers that lie ahead.

3 hours in, I managed to softlock the game by simply dying. I restarted at a checkpoint, and the bass drum plant that I needed to break a wall to progress wasn't working, and there was no way to backtrack. Even after restarting at the checkpoint several times, the bass drum launcher was still disabled. That was the final nail in the coffin.

It was just boring. I was waiting for some exciting gameplay, but it never clicked for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016610531', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1522838822}
review:
This game seemed quite fun and innovative, however after playing it for not very long at all the game crashed - and it crashes every time I started it. 

I don't think I did anything glitchy in the game, and seen as I can play most other games without a hitch I have to concldue that it's probably this game which is the cause of the crash. On that basis, I don' t recommend this game. Apologies that this is more a warning than a review.

review: Un gamplay bourr√© d'id√©e est diablement efficace! voila ce qu'est beatbuddy! l'univers de la musique prend forme de plein de maniere differente! d'ennemie, de scenario, de perso, d'histoire! cela me rappelle inside my radio mais ici c'est tout une aventure! (apres reste a savoir si elle est integralement sous-marine) c'est prenant et on s'attardera souvent sur le tempo des bruitage qui nous feront danser tous seul comme des kons* x"3 une bonde son original et un rythme qui pousse! j'vous avous que je m'attendais pas a autant venant de ce jeu! une veritable perle que je manquerai pas de faire en let"s play ;3 je le conseille! ps: appeler harmony! on va beat sur le monde la musique XDD

author: {'steamid': '76561198078242064', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1556211824}
review:
Erhielt ich als Random-Key f√ºr 2 Euro.
Der Soundtrack swingt und es f√§llt einem sehr schwer, still zu sitzen und nicht mit zu wippen beim spielen.

Die Grafik und Animationen sind sehr sch√∂n gemacht, Gameplay erinnert an die Jump N' Runs aus den 90'ern.

Spa√üiges Spiel f√ºr zwischendurch, dass Gute Laune macht. Ist seine 9 Euro definitiv wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 446, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1482145894}
review:
Wie nennt man denn einen Platformer wo man schwimmt statt h√ºpft? Schwimformer?
Naja auf jeden Fall ist Beatbuddy so was √§hnliches wie ein Platformer nur eben, man schwimmt. Und das ist ziemlich cool gemacht.
Fans von Hardcoreplatformer werden hier entt√§uscht, denn der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist moderat und nur ganz gegen Ende gibt es ein paar etwas herausforderndere Stellen, aber auch die sind nach einigen Versuchen und dank der fairen Speicherpunkte gemeistert.
Das Spiel dient mit seiner sanften Herausforderung, der coolen Musik und dem wunderbaren Stil v.a. eine eher relaxteren Partie. F√ºr mich war Beadbuddy ideal zur Entspannung auf dem Sofa. Das heisst nicht, dass es langweilig war, im Gegenteil. Aber eben, es ist auch keines dieser "ich knoble stundenlang an einer Stelle"-Spiele.

Fazit: Wer gem√ºtlich eine Runde zocken m√∂chte zur Erholung ist bei Beatbuddy perfekt aufgehoben.
(Ich war richtig entt√§uscht, als das Spiel fertig war, ganz nach dem Motto: Schade, das h√§tte noch lange so weitergehen d√ºrfen...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198167540743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1479671657}
review:
With a brilliant soundtrack and fun characters, I absolutely recommend this game.  Everything in the environments of this game behave in accordance to the beat of the music, and it's executed really well.

The story is fine.  Nothing groundbreaking, but it doesn't need to be.  The writing is still solid, and the puzzles are well crafted and appropriately challenging.  Give this game a shot for something fun and different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068180443', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1378, 'last_played': 1455584061}

Music based gameplay really brings it all together. The puzzles are fun and it's not too difficult in my opinion. Of course, as someone who finds Antichamber plausible, my opinion may not be the best. xD

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064852407', 'num_games_owned': 1250, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1412983500}
review:
It‚Äôs a strange rhythm game. Yep, rhythm is an important key in this game. In the first few level you might be able to brute force it, but then you‚Äôll hit a road block. So enjoy the game and listen to the music. The better you do the more complex and complete the music gets, and what a good music it is.
It‚Äôs a good game and a good experience, so give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2468, 'num_reviews': 928, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1473215103}
review:
Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians foi minha maior decep√ß√£o no steam nesse ultimo m√™s: jogo variando entre desafiante e divertido na medida certa, boa arte e trilha sonora √≥tima e mesclando completamente com os elementos do game. Eu realmente estava determinado a terminar o jogo por todos esses aspectos, por isso ignorei alguns bugs nos controles, s√≥ que quanto mais me aproximei dos √∫ltimos cap√≠tulos mais frequente se tornaram os bugs, e maiores tamb√©m: fui obrigado a reiniciar uma fase porque entrei em uma sala na hora errada (a sa√≠da que havia funcionado, simplesmente n√£o funcionava mais) e outra porque morri, meu checkpoint me trouxe de volta, mas antes de eu destrancar o caminho, s√≥ que as ferramentas que eu devia usar pra abrir o caminho haviam sumido. E o pior √© que esses bugs parecem estar no jogo a muito tempo, os devs nunca arrumaram, isso √© frustrante DEMAIS. Por isso minha n√£o recomenda√ß√£o, desisto do jogo, mas desisto triste.
------------------------------------------------------
Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians was my biggest disappointment in steam this last month: ranging from challenging to fun just right, good art and great soundtrack that merges completely with the game elements. I was really determined to finish the game by all these aspects, so I ignored some bugs in the controls, only the more I approached the last chapters, most frequent became the bugs, and bigger too: I was forced to restart a stage because I entered a room at the wrong time (the exit that had worked simply no longer worked) and another because I died, my checkpoint brought me back, but before I unlock the way out, only the tools that I must use to open the way had disappeared. And the worst is that these bugs seem to be in the game a long time, the devs never tidied, it is f* frustrating. So there is my "not recommendation", give up the game, but give up sad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970735557', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1472186562}
review: Now here's a game which is entirely its own thing. It's a bit like Alice: Madness Returns in that it has six very, very long levels which tend to be constructed from a rather small handful of mechanics, but they're all exceptionally pretty, and the game's integration with the music is impressive. By the last level I was tiring a little of the toolbox, but the last level itself has some good twists - sometimes literally - and overall I think it's well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130657097', 'num_games_owned': 1851, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1469273863}
review:
Beatbuddy : Tale of the Guardians.

Beatbuddy : Tale of the guardians is an unremarkable game. A game where the soundtrack seems to be the only saving grace.  Usually, I like games like beatbuddy where there are some good puzzles, an interesting character, a good premise, tight controls and then a fabulous soundtrack to accompany it. But Beatbuddy tries to carry the whole title on the soundtrack. 

Gameplay
You play as Beatbuddy, who awakes from his sleep and then embarks on a quest to save his own immortality and his companions. You move to the sound of the beats that are present in an underwater world. The controls ‚Äúfeel‚Äù clunky even though they are not. As beatbuddy moves underwater, you can sense a slow movement scheme where you want to move him faster. The puzzles in the title are fairly easy and present little challenge.  The game is also very repetitive in nature.
Visuals
Beatbuddy : Tale of the guardians features hand painted levels which are gorgeous to look at. Though there isn‚Äôt much variety in the environment so after sometime, they begin to look stale. In the start though, it is a joy to transverse through these levels. The level design is pretty decent but not excellent. Overall, in visuals Beatbuddy looks good without having much variety.
Soundtrack
Soundtrack is the meat of the Beatbuddy: Tale of the guardians. The music kicks in depending on the mood and never lets go. As I said, you can‚Äôt carry a game on the soundtrack itself, so as you play Beatbuddy further, your only focus remains on the soundtrack which then ruins the mood itself. Even then, the soundtrack in Beatbuddy is excellent to say the least.
The Verdict
Beatbuddy is a wholly unremarkable game. Repetitive, Bland, Uninteresting are a  few words that can be used to describe it. I couldn‚Äôt bring myself to finish the game, as it felt so tedious to play through it. But if you want to give Beatbuddy; Tale of the guardians a try, wait for a sale as paying full price for this game will disappoint you to say the least.


This review is brought to you by Steamified. For similar reviews and fantastic giveaways please visit http://www.steamified.com/.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025188158', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1469343222}
review:
Beatbuddy's strongest assest is easily its soundtrack. Beatbuddy's soundtrack has strong tunes of electroswing and funk and is overall pretty darn groovy. Though, Austin Wintory's track does suffer when it's stripped down to its bassline.
Overall the gameplay isn't bad. The gameplay you bounce to the beat and solve puzzles and traverse the levels. I think level design-wise it's constructed pretty well. If you're not a fan of it though, the game can be pretty repetative and uninteresting. I wouldn't go out of my way to buy it, but I got it in a bundle and I enjoyed what I got. I think it doesn't deserve most of the flak it gets, though the 2nd to last level was a little rough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189653171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1468982240}

review:
Burning through my 100+ backlog, or game purchased from Steam sales, Humble monthly, etc. As such, my criteria for a positive recommendation are based on the first 5 minutes. Does the UI work? Does steam overlay work? Does the game actually run and render in 4K? 

Giving this title a positive review for the new approach on a side scroller, good graphics, excellent sound design, a joy to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198159585437', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1576311944}
review:
I do recommend this game, but with a couple of warnings: 

I'm up to the last chapter of the 5th level, and I've had to go back to the menu and restart a chapter three times so far due to glitches preventing me from proceeding. I've spent absolutely ages swimming around trying to see if I've missed something, but checking out the discussion boards about the game, it seems like these are common bugs which have been occurring for a couple of years.

Also, while the music is good, it can get a *bit* repetitive; it might have been nice to have a little more variety.

HOWEVER, when the game is working fine, it's ridiculously good fun. A really unique play mechanism with some puzzles having a nice and challenging level of difficulty. They've nailed the difficulty curve.

Its standard price is ¬£6.99 ($9.99 US I think?) which is *probably* worth it due to the amount of fun I've got out of it. But if you see it in a bundle or on, say, 50% off, it's an essential purchase for people who like 2D puzzle platformers.

review:
A funny little musical puzzle platformer; from the easy side. The world moves on the beat, and you have to solve some puzzles while swimming in the sea.

The story is non-sensical, and could entirely be ignored (and it stopped rather unexpectedly); however, this game is FOR THE BEAT. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198047800149', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1460868633}
review:
Nothing particularly bad about this, just completely not notable in any way in my opinion. Felt very run of the mill. It's not awful or bad even, it's just a way to pass a few hours I guess. But there are more or less objectively better ways to do that (like I'm sorry, I understand that it's opinion but I really think that if you're a person that's been playing video games for any semi-significant length of time at all, you will think this is very generic--I think that's a fairly reasonable assumption to make). The game just doesn't feel like it has any identity or reason for existence beyond "another indie 2D platformer/puzzle game in a sea of indie 2D platformer/puzzle games".

Its underwater so you're not tethered to the ground in the 2D space. Has some strong music (I mean it's called Beatbuddy and it's sorta music-themed in concept so the music is fairly varied and not bad). 6 Levels, about 40-60m each. Really not challenging at all, even near the end as the difficulty ramped up, everything was fairly easy. Honestly, any difficulty or annoyance came almost entirely from the annoyingly floaty controls (I used mouse option, there are "Keyboard" and "Gamepad"  options as well. It's never bad enough to hinder progress though, as the difficulty isn't high at all as mentioned for it to become a massive headache. The "puzzles" are all very on-rails, you don't have to think, it's just sorta "pull lever, push crate" (figuratively). A lot of repeating puzzle pieces just thrown together in different ways throughout the game, more pieces as you go further.

The game seems to be into this idea that the beat of the music tracks in each of its level is synchronized to various environmental elements and mechanics of its puzzles, and while this might be technically true (i.e., an object you can interact with that serves as like a bounce-pad is pulsating to the beat), in practice I never found myself actually concerned with using that to help me *play the game*, which it sort of advertises as a selling point, but also via it's early tutorial. This might be somewhat subjective, as maybe other people would use that more as a play tool, but I found it far easier to just ignore all that and use visual cues as in any other game (i.e. if there are like spikes that drop and raise, even if they "cycle" with the song, it's easier to just watch the spikes and then time your passage...).

Graphics are uh, fine. Somewhat pretty , levels look repetitive (similar art assets I mean) but they all sort of have a cartoony stylization. Really nothing eye-popping, definitely far from the most beautiful 2D game I've seen, recently or otherwise. Look at some screenshots to judge of course.

I encountered a bug in Level 5 , where upon going through a door and the camera starting to zoom out on the environment after a certain puzzle, the client crashed literally every time (Unity engine error). Was not a 1-time thing, always hapspened as I moved the character through this point. After looking around and finding no solution, I verified game cache and that seemed to work. Notably, the game hitched and stuttered , but didn't crash at that point still. 

Also , the game has no v-sync option, v-sync force doesn't work via Nvidia control panel. I'm running a GTX 770, and it was basically just eating the card to run at like 1000+ frames per second (no, that's not a zero too many. Over 1 thousand frames. Basically if you have a dedicated gpu of any description, beware). Was incredibly annoying, and I ended up artificially capping the frame rate with RivaTuner. Which caused the game to occassionally experience some weird stuttering. Sort of amateurish that there's no Vysync option tbh, or anything else that'd solve that issue.

________________________________________

Pros: 

- Strong, varied music, all catchy and pretty unique in the video game landscape.
- Visually decent.

Cons: 

- Boring puzzles, not challenging or thought-provoking
- Poor control of character (floaty)
- Repetitive level design
- Generic
- Somewhat buggy
- Doesn't support vsync

author: {'steamid': '76561197999920602', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 622, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1504549181}
review: The first level of this game is a great experience - discovering creatures the build up the background loop. The music in the game is awesome, and it's relaxing to play. In the later stages, the gameplay can get a bit frustrating, and the dialogue and story aren't great, but it's worth playing just for the music. A charming cross between Aquaria and the Star Wars Cantina band.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116384968', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1459191223}
review:
(Pi√π una prima impressione che una recensione)

Questo gioco non fa nulla in modo tremendo, ma allo stesso tempo risulta piuttosto blando, generico e non terribilmente intereressante.

Il gameplay e le meccaniche sono fin troppo semplici, mentre stile di disegno e colonna sonora sono entrambi competenti e gradevoli, ma risultano piuttosto triti.
Storia, atmosfera, dialoghi e personaggi potevano anche non essere inclusi per quanto sono irrilevanti.

A primo acchito, il gioco viaggia tra "accettabile" e "mediocre".

author: {'steamid': '76561198028429100', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1455144197}
review:
TL;DR: It's not bad. It's well made, but it's too bland for a definite reccommendation.

This game, uh... I don't know how to put this. I mean, I just completed it one minute ago but I think I can sum things up.
If you skip this title, you're not missing much. I don't feel like my time was wasted, but there are more interesting games out there that I can't say pick this one up. I got it as a Humble Bundle order, and honestly wouldn't have played it if it weren't for that fact. Don't get me wrong, what it does is alright. For the most part the obstacles move to the beat rather than you, which is unique along with its art and setting.
I'm only giving it a thumbs-down because I don't ESPECIALLY recommend it. If there were a more neutral option I'd give it. It's not an involving game, so if you need that then it might suit you. I'm pretty sure this was a college project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100994803', 'num_games_owned': 2324, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1454246611}
review:
The soundtrack is amazing. Its one of the better ones Ive found in a rhythm game, and I like how they incorporated it into the actual gameplay and environment. I liked having to time my hits to break through bubbles or to break those flower things in the later levels. I can see how some people might get irritated with it though because the game is set underwater, and you have a bit of lag/delay. It isnt too bad to get used to though.

Graphics were pretty nice too. I loved the animations, especially the idle ones. The environment was a little same-y after awhile (lot of recoloring it seemed like), but still gorgeous. 

Controls (especially vehicle ones) werent my favorite, but luckily they dont stick you in the bubble car very often. Trying to actually time the speed boost in the vehicle was a bit irritating, but holding the right click seemed to do it automatically, so I cant complain too much. 

The puzzles themselves werent too bad. None of them were overly complicated or frustrating, but some did get a little repetitive in the earlier levels. Still pretty enjoyable though.

The story is one of the weaker parts of the game. It isnt the strongest story out there, and the characters arent very memorable. Personally, I think the gameplay more than makes up for the weak story though.

Its different, which is nice to see with so many puzzle platformers out there. The controls take getting used to, but once you do it plays very well. The audio is beyond relaxing and the environments are gorgeous. Id highly recommend it, especially if you catch it on sale or in a bundle somewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978025240', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1453165269}
review:
People call this a platformer game.

I disagree.  This is more of a bullet hell rhythm hybrid.

Fist thing to note, is that the sound track is probably one of the best things about this game.  As it should, too, as the majority of gameplay mechanics are built around the beat of that soundtrack.

There isn't much in form of a story, sadly, but what's there is enough to at least give a sense of purpose and the characters created are rather colorful and entertaining to view/interact with.

This is more of a relaxing/casual game than anything, so keep that in mind.

~STL

author: {'steamid': '76561198085367707', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1435551608}
review:
Peculiar jogo de aventura com grande influ√™ncia musical, Beatbuddy diz respeito a um desiquil√≠brio em Symphonia, o mundo da m√∫sica, causado por um imperador cruel que pretendia calar todas as notas e toma-las para si.

O avan√ßo nas fases se d√° conforme os sons propostos que dever√£o ser acompanhados pelo jogador para resolver os desafios que v√£o surgindo pelo caminho, acrescentando-se novos sons e novas formas de combina-l√≥s √† medida em que se avan√ßa na campanha.

H√° um toque de humor nos di√°logos, que aliados a uma bela produ√ß√£o de arte feitas durante os 6 capitulos do jogo, tornam tudo bem interessante. A maioria dos desafios propostos n√£o s√£o t√£o desafiadores assim, alguns at√© muito obvios, mas nada que n√£o possa ser relevado.

No geral, Beatbuddy √© um jogo bacana, que eu joguei sem esperar muita coisa, mas acabei achando divertido. Pode-se dizer que √© pelo menos diferente da maioria das coisa que se v√™ por ai. BOM (7/10)

review:
Apaisant, dynamique, rythmique ...
L'univers poss√®de un level design digne de certains contes.
La musique est en phase avec le jeu, savoir jouer en rythme aide beaucoup, mais n'est pas indispensable non plus.
Jamais tr√®s dur au point de recommencer certains passages plus de 5 ou 6 fois, le jeu alterne puzzle et recherche d'√©l√©ment, affrontement contre quelques cr√©atures, parcours du combattant sem√©s d'embuches.
Les levels sont plut√¥t vari√©s, et pour la dur√©e assez courte du jeu, c'est suffisant.
L'histoire derri√®re le jeu est un pretexte int√©ressant, mais pas forc√©ment la plus captivante qui soit, ceci dit, les r√©pliques sont parfois assez caustiques.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994799155', 'num_games_owned': 1524, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1468307984}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043031097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1541864771}
review:
Yes I recommend this game BUT not to everypony.

Beatbuddy is, mostly, a rhythm game before everything else. Of course you have some puzzles, you have some exploration, action, even some auto-scrolling... plus, regarding how you're playing, it can be a point'n click, and that is quite funny, I love it that way. You can choose between gamepad / keyboard or mouse. Not keyboard AND mouse, but keyboard OR mouse.

So yes, it's a rhythm game. You're free to go where you want, but the enemies and various obstacles are all based on the rhythm of the soundtrack (which is great, try to listen to it in iTunes). So if you're not fond of this kind of gameplay, maybe you'll not like this game. Plus, the puzzles are not really that hard. It's not an easy game, but it's not really hard either.

Because what I like is this kind of "flow" you feel when you're playing, your actions matching with the tempo, that feeling that everything is going well, you're "in". I don't really know how to explain it, because I feel it, but you got the idea I hope.

Pros:
- amazing OST if you like electronic music (electro swing and stuff)
- easy controlling
- the graphics, not really the quality (it's good though) but the atmosphere you know?

Cons:
- not really hard
- low replay value

Those are not really cons if you can enjoy the game enough the first time you play. I think it's worth its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040494704', 'num_games_owned': 817, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1445507834}
review:
A very charming beat-keeping puzzle game. Gorgeous art, fluid animation and a killer soundtrack that changes depending on what's on screen. Everything keeps to the beat, from the pulsating plants to the animations of the main character.

The puzzles within are simple, yet challenging enough to keep you playing, and often rely on matching the beat to succeed. The game is controlled entirely with the mouse, so laptop gamers and people with no sense of rhythm need not apply. Other than that, I can highly recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975895891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 425, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1445282948}
review:
Wieder so ein Spiel f√ºr das man einen dritten Daumen br√§uchte. Das Spiel ist zwar in Ordnung, aber krankt f√ºr mich am zu langsamen Pacing. Die R√§tsel sind sich alle sehr √§hnlich und lassen sich eher durch mehr Aufwand als durch Grips l√∂sen. Soundtrack ist nat√ºrlich Geschmackssache, aber es variiert zu wenig. Hab das Gef√ºhl stundenlang die selbe Musik zu h√∂ren, bevor es mal nen neuen Sound gibt. So hat mich die Musik eher genervt als bei der Stange gehalten. 

Wer seichte Puzzleplattformer ohne viel Anspruch mag, der kann es sich ruhig mal anschauen. Der Rhythmus spielt gar keine allzugro√üe Rolle. Der Beat beeinflusst zwar die Umgebung, aber man kommt auch zurecht ohne auf ihn achten zu m√ºssen Das raubt einem leider viel Motivation, da so der Anspruch verloren geht. H√∂rt bei Youtube mal in den Soundtrack rein. Wenn er euch zusagt, dann holt es euch ruhig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043216138', 'num_games_owned': 1653, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1442689933}
review:
Al ver por primera vez BeatBuddy nos preguntamos si no estuvi√©semos frente al t√≠pico indie que tiene una idea original detr√°s, pero que nos hace dudar si los desarrolladores la han conseguido ejecutar correctamente. 
Desde luego no podemos negar que este juego destaca principalmente por su est√©tica y su apartado musical, los cuales, para mi gusto est√°n sorprendentemente bien cuidados.
En cuanto a jugabilidad, BeatBuddy cuenta con unos controles muy simples y c√≥modos para jugar con mando, y responde perfectamete en todo momento. Esto, unido a unas mec√°nicas simples y a una dificultad bastante baja, hacen de BeatBuddy un juego sencillo y f√°cil de jugar.
Tanta sencillez, tanto en mec√°nicas como en dificultad podr√≠a convertirlo en un juego repetitivo y tedioso, de no ser por su corta duraci√≥n y su variedad de escenarios. 
BeatBuddy consta de 6 niveles tem√°ticos de 1h aproximada de duraci√≥n cada uno, en los que alternaremos entre el control de Beat y su nave, lo que aporta un poco de variedad en la forma de juego. Durante estos 6 niveles, dar√° tiempo de sobra a que se desarrolle la historia, el punto m√°s flojo de este juego para mi gusto: Eres uno de los 3 guardianes de la m√∫sica, que despiertan cuando el pr√≠ncipe intenta controlar todo su poder, y debes frustrar sus planes. 

En definitiva, estamos frente a un juego con un gameplay sencillo, de corta duraci√≥n e historia simple, aunque fresco y novedoso a la vez, con una est√©tica y m√∫sica que conjuntan a la perfecci√≥n, consiguiendo una inmersi√≥n total en el mismo que te dejar√° con muy buen sabor de boca.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003284649', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1438413847}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025820005', 'num_games_owned': 1706, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1442173951}
review:
Music in this game is astoundingly good. Sadly, the level design is uninspired and the puzzles are repetitive. The checkpoint system doesn't work super well, leading to many broken event triggers.

Made it to chapter 4 before encountering a checkpoint bug that stuck me in one area of a level, and no further progress was possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053169595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1442166744}
review:
Was very disappointed in the controls and the gameplay. The only real pro was the music, but it never reached its full potential. The reason why I bought this game was to hear the music, yet many of the games mechanics like hitting objects to remove spikes and finding secret buttons muted the music. The puzzles did not feel satisfying because generally you have to just memorize paths and could be done in one go. Controls feel delayed especially when in vehicles as it forces you to move to the beat. Dashing around also feels really weird as when you press and hold you move faster at the expense of control.

Overall this is a bellow average game where its strengths are hurt by its gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023903090', 'num_games_owned': 1531, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1441406069}
review:
Tale of the Guardians es un juego de aventuras y puzzle ambientado en el fondo marino. Los habitantes de este mundo, conocidos como Symphonian, se mueven al ritmo de la m√∫sica la cual va a estar muy presente durante todo el juego.

Muchos enemigos o zonas se comportan de una forma u otra seg√∫n la m√∫sica o los sonidos procedentes de otros elementos del mapa, por lo que en algunas situaciones solo hay que seguir el ritmo para superar estos obst√°culos.

Gr√°ficamente el juego sorprende bastante, los detalles est√°n bien cuidados y transportan al jugador a este peque√±o gran mundo musical subacu√°tico.

El juego tiene una demo, as√≠ que pod√©is probarlo antes de decidir si comprarlo o no.

Aprovechad si lo encontrais de oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020748121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1522424956}
review: El juego b√°sicamente consiste en avanzar resolviendo puzzles y ir derrotando o esquivando a los enemigos y obst√°culos que nos encontramos por el camino. El protagonismo por encima de todo est√° en la m√∫sica, cada enemigo emite su propio sonido, los personajes hacen beatbox a la hora de hablarnos y incluso es necesario seguir el ritmo de la musica de fondo  para manejar con rapidez un veh√≠culo o acabar con cierto enemigo golpeandolo con ritmo. Afortunadamente la m√∫sica es de calidad, variada y se disfruta mucho, el control es bueno y reacciona al instante. Los gr√°ficos en 2d como se puede ver en cualquier v√≠deo sobre el juego sin ser lo m√°s son muy agradables a la vista, destacando sobre todo el buen dise√±o y animaci√≥n de personajes y enemigos .  Por ponerle un punto negativo o no tan bueno, tal vez los escenarios podr√≠an estar todavia m√°s trabajados, los elementos que los componen resultan bastante simples en comparaci√≥n al resto. Mejorando eso y a√±adiendo f√≠sicas para las algas, cajas, etc., dar√≠a para un remaster de estos que est√°n tan de moda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086917932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1441170693}
review:
Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians; an indie platformer from Threaks. Let‚Äôs get rocking (and rightly so with this one).

The Good

To be honest, I hadn‚Äôt even heard of this game until it came with last week‚Äôs Humble Bundle, but am I glad that it came in that glorious bundle of games. Beatbuddy is easily one of the most satisfying games I have ever played and an multiple levels at that. The whole game is, quite literally, moving to the beat. Do you have any idea how good that feels?

Not only was the whole game keeping rhythm, the music was excellent. I‚Äôm personally a big fan of Parov Stellar, so, when I found out about that contribution to the soundtrack, I was pretty stoked. Every level features a different song from a different artist, but manages to keep the same flow.

The design in Beatbuddy is simply marvelous (for the most part). It‚Äôs rare to see such a creative game in terms of world building and (especially) naming things cleverly.

The Bad

I‚Äôve got nothing bad to say about this one, sorry.

The Meh

There are some parts of the game where it becomes overly difficult to maneuver with your character. It‚Äôs not a huge problem or anything (and maybe I just suck), but it can be quite frustrating.

Verdict: Yea

You have absolutely zero reasons not be playing this game within the next week or so. If you‚Äôve been looking for something new and something far different than most platformers, Beatbuddy is the game for you. You can find it here on Steam if you‚Äôre interested (and you should be). It may end up on Humble Bundle‚Äôs End of Summer Sale too so keep an eye on that. As always, thanks for reading.

review: I HATE having to give this game such a bad review, cause i loved playing it up to a certain point. I got to the Organ Level and everything was great, suddenly the game started glitching. It's a music/beat based game and yet some of the wildlife that are supposed to move in time with the music, weren't moving, which means i couldn't use them. I have restarted and reloaded the game over and over and yet this keeps happening. I believe that i have played it to a point where it is unbeatable. If anyone knows any way around these glitches, please let me know as i would LOVE to finish this game, but as it stands now...i must advise against purchasing this product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044096999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1440176430}
review:
Clearly a labor of love, Beatbuddy shines in its aesthetic, world, and gameplay "feel." Everything around you moves to the beat of the music. Even your own vehicle gets a speed boost every other beat. 

This all comes together to make a game that *usually* feels great to play. While the developers have obviously put a lot of thought into designing each level, there are still segments that are simply not fun to play. In many situations, you will find yourself punished and killed for making a wrong decision in a fast-paced segment. This happens often enough and comes with a large enough punishment that it really does detract from the gameplay.

It feels like this problem comes from over-attachment to problematic gameplay elements. For example, throughout the game, there are these "music sources" which are unstable and explode after you've held them long enough. You have to deliver these sources to an appropriate receptacle or risk restarting the segment. While having segments like this helps the game from feeling too same-y, it's a bad choice and should have been scrapped or re-imagined.

To be honest, though, these flaws are the kind of thing that most games have. It might have a few more of them than average, but they only stand out because they occasionally disrupt the magical experience that this game has to offer. Despite my occasional frustration, I finished this game in a single sitting and came away delighted that I'd put in the time. I would recommend this game to anyone who's at all interested by the trailer. Just don't expect it to be perfectly polished.

(For those who care, playtime isn't tremendously long for a $10 game. But I don't really think it's fair to judge games by playtime; you're paying for the art, music, and creativity. If you're hesitant, get it on sale.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198077538197', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1498841850}
review:
Even if I feel mixed, I'll recomend this game.

The graphics are beautiful.
The gameplay is really cool but tend to be the same all the way to the end. (I wanted to see more "music tricks")
The musics are awesome but tend to be long after a long play... Mainly because of the tempo : and this is why I feel mixed about this game.

Basically you'll need 30min for each chunk of the game. It is good enough to apreciate the music without hating it. this part is well done.
But what I did not like is that there is no variation of the tempo : every songs have the same tempo ! 
So even if the music change every 30min, it's getting anoying after a while...

Still, I recommend this game !

author: {'steamid': '76561198076039301', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1433430120}
review:
Es ist jedes Mal wieder traurig es zu schreiben, aber: Eines der sehr wenigen Spiele in meiner Bibliothek, an welchem deutsche Entwickler beteiligt waren! ;)

BEATBUDDY: TotG ist ein sehr musikalisches Indiegame, das in etwa 4 Stunden Spielzeit bis zum Ende bietet und diese Zeit f√ºllt das Spiel mit tollen Rhythmen, einer netten kleinen Story und einem konkurrenzf√§higem Grafikstil! Bugs suchte ich vergeblich, die Steuerung per X360-Controller ist weitaus besser als mit Tastatur/Maus.

Gesamtbewertung: 80/100

GAMEPLAY: Sehr fl√ºssige, eingehende Steuerung, die bei dieser Spiell√§nge aber nicht zu simpel und einschr√§nkend wirkt. [90/100]

STORY: S√º√üe, kurze Story, welche perfekt in den Spielflu√ü eingebaut ist. Einen Blockbusters darf man nat√ºrlich nicht erwarten, doch auf Indie-Niveau absolut in Ordnung. [80/100]

GRAFIK: Sehr netter Grafikstil, keine Unsch√∂nheiten, die Produktbeschreibung verspricht nicht zu viel! Auch die Animationen des Beatbuddy sehen cool aus. Allerdings finde ich den Look der Men√ºs absto√üend [90/100]

SOUND: Die rhythmische Musik ist definitiv das Kernelement dieses Titels. Die Musik ist immer auf die derzeitige Spielgeschwindigkeit abgestimmt (oder anders herum :D ) und ist eing√§ngig. Allerdings findet sich hier keine neue 'Star-Wars-Musik', die sich jedermann nach dem ersten H√∂ren merken kann; auch nicht im Soundtrack. Somit: [85/100]

=> Alles in allem ein nettes Indie-Game mit einer f√ºr dieses Spielprinzip genau rcihtigen L√§nge und netten Ideen. Sehr guter Zeitvertreib -> [80/100]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025926879', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1443469383}
review:
I can absolutely recommend this game. I agree in a way with the sluggish controls many reviewers describe but they rarely keep me from really enjoying this game. They just become part of the challenge and I feel you can master them without being too irritated about it. The pure fun and enjoyment of simple but groovy gameplay is all worth it though and the puzzles do progress the further you go. I've been playing this game with my projector on a 100 inch scale and the visuals and detail in the art are mind-blowing. At times it's like an lsd-trip.

This game was completely worth it for me.
 If you're not sure, just get it in a sale, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128622576', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1437373160}
review:
This game was not as fun as I thought it would be, but it was okay. Not the kind of game I'd get immersed into and play for hours straight... rather 10 minutes at a time, because the game tends to get annoying if you play it for longer periods. The graphics are colorful and nice, the animations smooth, the gameplay a bit dull, the controls somewhat tedious but not catastrophic either. I'd still recommend it because the way the music is integrated into the game is original and pretty well done, and the tracks themselves are good (except for level 5 which was quite a bit grating...). I also appreciated the nice little details, such as skippable intro logos (a rare and precious attention) and the fact that you can still control the character during the ending credits.

I give this game 6/10, and if there was to be a Beatbuddy 2 with solid improvements, I think I'd consider buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049130822', 'num_games_owned': 1421, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1705297736}
review:
This is a very simple game that requires some problem solving to get through the levels. The game mechanics are simple and I've seen it done in many others. That said, what sets this game apart is the incorporation of the music into the gameplay. You have to match the beat to get through certain areas. The music is great, and I love that the character voices are different beatboxing beats for each character. The artwork in the game is very pleasing with the bright colors and the animation in the environment adds visual cues to help you match the beat.

While playing this game I found myself tapping my foot and nodding my head to the beat. Great way to spend a relaxing afternoon, and the little blobby characters brought a smile to my face.

I'd definitely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023559435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1436753958}
review: The game is sort of a puzzle platformer type thing, but is not really a platformer. Rather, you click places and move there. The music theme is nice, but I found the controls awkward and the puzzles were more time-consuming than engaging. The reason I don't recommend the game is because I think it glitched into a unbeatable state in the second half of the organ level then saved a checkpoint, and I cannot continue the game.

review: Beautiful graphics, great music and some really creative ideas but I can't recommend it due to quite a few bugs/glitches and the fact that the controls/mechanics of this game make me really angry whenever I try to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996760968', 'num_games_owned': 1341, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1393951353}
review:
I love rhythm and heavily music influenced games.  I've a downright sensational rhythm if I do say so myself.  I played the demo for this nearly a year before it was released and was absolutely hyped... then the full game came out.

With such an ominous intro like that, how could this be a thumbs up?  Well, it's still a nice and casual adventure game with a silly story and characters that functions correctly most of the time.  It has a lot of heart put into it with the fine details like the "voice overs" and the graphics and rhythm syncing, but it feels... lacking.

The demo had this insanely upbeat and cool song that's difficult to find today, and being a beta demo I figured some things would change from there to the final product.  I was wrong.  The songs now are more like background beats that the game just sort of arbitrarily bounces to.  You could take the rhythmic pulses out of the game and have almost the same game with less "stuttering".

I can still recommend this, though.  The characters are cute, the mood is lighthearted, the songs are still fun, and it still pulls off the adventure bit with light puzzle elements, but oh what this game could have been.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119046494', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 66, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1710117489}
review: Ich habe diese Spiel durchgespielt und muss sagen das ich es sehr lustig und gut gemacht finde. Es war sehr sch√∂nes Design und einen genialen Soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088831334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1435225464}
review:
I am surprised by how good this game is.  It is a rhythm puzzle platforming game.  It is really fun moving around with the great beat, and the puzzles are really good.  I love how the game looks: colorful and smooth.  The animations and controls are awesome.  The story is very simple, but for this type of game, it is alright.

It is good for 5-6 hours of fun with possible replay value.  Pick it up when it is on sale if you like rhythm, puzzle, or platforming games!

Es h√§tte aber noch viel mehr drin sein k√∂nnen.

review: This game has lots of pretty colors, and the musical rhythm worked into the gameplay is unique. Unfortunately, those two aspects do not change the fact that the gameplay is pretty identical to a myriad of other games out there. Now I love shooters. I have played tons of shooters and there isn't really one I regret playing because each is unique and different in it's own way. If you feel the same way about this genre, then maybe this game is for you.

review:
Amazing towards the end, when it actually forces you to listen to what you hear and move to the beat. Until then, far too easy - I was able to beat most of it like a regular (kind of) platformer, and because of that Beatbuddy seemed unrealized.
Still, if you enjoy music games, worth trying out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981891635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1430326695}
review:
Fun little game. Good few hours worth of content. Nice story, and the music is awesome! Big fan of game and music intergration, and it works really well. Good sense of humour and doesn't take it self very seriously, which I like. 
Only down side for me to this game, is the controls. I found them very clunky and never fully got used to using either the keyboard or the mouse. Seems to be optimised for a controller. 

Decent game though, worth a grab if cheap and on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995211255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1653960972}
review: This game is a must have. The music is amazing and highly addictive. I found myself humming along to the music as I played. The levels can be challenging but not so difficult as to be impassable. It did glitch out on me a couple of times and I had to save and exit and then re-launch and it worked fine. I generally get bored with games and leave them in favor of a new game. I played this all the way through to the end. I highly recommend this game to everyone. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028635556', 'num_games_owned': 1079, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1430204479}
review:
I really don't know how to feel about Beatbuddy. The game isn't really fun but it isn't really boring either. It's just a simple game where you flip switches and flow down corridors whilst the music changes based upon environmental hazards. The music is enjoyable but the game doesn't really compliment it a lot of the time. If you want a Music game this one has music and it's a game but that doesn't make it a music game. 

The story isn't something to write about as I felt there really wasn't a story. The Deus Ex Machina at the end really ruined anything that was going on in the game and then it just suddenly ends. The story feels tacked on and hardly there. 

The Soundtrack is nice but doesn't really compliment the game in any way. It's a very Electro Swing heavy OST by some big names but overall I felt that it's more of an advertisement for the artists than anything. 

Overall this game is very mediocre. It isn't really fun and only held my attention for the first couple levels. The last levels just left me dissatisfied and overall perturbed when I completed the game. This game is okay, but there are pleanty of better games available.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996113496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3324, 'last_played': 1429385396}
review:
Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians entf√ºhrt den Spieler in eine Welt, die von [b]Rhythmus und Musik[/b] bestimmt wird. In der comichaften zweidimensionalen Unterwasserwelt bewegt sich alles zum Bass der Musik. Die Hindernisse, die Gegner und bald schon man selbst.

Die Entwickler legen offensichtlich gro√üen Wert auf [b]Innovationen im Gameplay[/b]. Entsprechend knapp haben Sie die Geschichte und die Spielwelt gehalten. B√∂ser Prinz entf√ºhrt Schwester um alle Musik zu kontrollieren. Der Spielheld muss das verhindern. Mit Blick auf das Gameplay ist die durch Einblendung von Sprechblasen erz√§hlte Geschichte mehr als ausreichend. Der Fokus liegt auf dem Spielgef√ºhl.

Und das begeistert, jedenfalls zu Anfang. Was in anderen Spielen die Hand-Auge-Koordination ist, ist bei Beatbuddy die [b]Hand-Geh√∂r-Koordination[/b]. Schnell lernt man, die Entwicklung der Spielwelt mit Hilfe des eigenen Geh√∂rs vorauszuahnen und das eigene Spiel daran anzupassen. Durchschwimmt die Spielfigur etwa eine knifflige Passage, welche sich nur zu bestimmten Rhythmen √∂ffnet, so muss sie den richtigen Zeitpunkt erahnen. Das ist [b]ausgesprochen innovativ[/b] und macht gerade zu Anfang sehr viel Spa√ü.

Umso bedauerlicher ist, dass die Entwickler weder das Innovationstempo, noch das Musikkonzept konsequent durchhalten. Zum einen beschr√§nkt sich die Auswirkung der Musik auf die Spielwelt im Grunde auf den Bass. Und der ist bin√§r. An. Und dann Aus. An. Aus. Da w√§re so viel mehr m√∂glich gewesen, selbst wenn man nur Takt und Bass genommen h√§tte. Zum anderen driftet das Spiel [b]mit fortschreitender Entwicklung wieder ins Koventionelle[/b] ab. Irgendwann muss sich der Spieler mit Parasiten rumschlagen, denen die sonst so harmonische Welt egal ist. Sie greifen einfach immer an, ohne R√ºcksicht auf den Beat. An vielen anderen Stellen ger√§t das Spiel einfach zur Geschicklichkeits√ºbung, ohne dass die Musik eine Rolle spielt. 

Weniger begeisternd ist auch das Leveldesign. Obwohl die Welt des Beatbuddys [b]optisch durchaus sch√∂n anzusehen[/b] ist, ist die zunehmende Labyrinthartigkeit der Level doch nur vorget√§uscht. Tats√§chlich bleiben sie linear, die Wegfindung minimal und ein ganz erheblicher Teil besteht nur im Durchschwimmen kniffliger Passagen. Ganz besonders markant ist aber, dass die immer [b]gleichen Konzepte permament wiederholt[/b] werden. Sei es nun eine Art Wagen, der in Parasitenpassagen durch die Reihen des Gegners schl√ºpft. Die Spielfigur, die sich √ºber Spiegel gegen Korallen schie√üen l√§sst, damit diese zerplatzen und den weg frei geben. Oder die schie√üenden Schnecken, die sich in puncto Nervigkeit mit schwimmenden stachlichen Am√∂ben abwechseln. In den ersten zwei Leveln ist alles neu und innovativ. Aber dann kommt leider nur noch wenig. 

Immerhin, und wie sollte es anders sein, gelingt den Entwicklern eine [b]tolle musikalische Unterst√ºtzung[/b]. Die elektronischen Kl√§nge mit zum Teil ambitioniertem wortlosen Gesang sind jedoch absolut gelungen. Was die Spielmusik angeht l√§uft dieses Indiegame einfach mal AAA-Titeln den Rang ab. Allein daf√ºr lohnt Beatbuddy. 

Da verzeiht man auch den [b]recht einfachen Schwierigkeitsgrad.[/b] Von Beginn an ist das Spiel keine Herausforderung, nicht einmal f√ºr Casualgamer. Wenige Passagen fordern ab und an ein ausgesprochen schnelles Handeln, aber abseits dessen ist das Spiel kaum Herausforderung.

Im Ergebnis bietet Beatbuddy vor allem eins: [b]Innovation[/b], was das Spielgef√ºhl angeht. Das das nicht durchgehalten wird, bleibt verziehen. Gerade die Spielmusik gibt des Spiel einen [b]Indiecharme[/b], der einem einfach ein gutes Gef√ºhl gibt. Ich empfehle es daher gerne weiter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 466, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1428460190}
review:
[code]Puedes ver m√°s rese√±as como esta en la mentor√≠a [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Esta rese√±a no contiene spoilers[/h1]

Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians ha sido una sorpresa absoluta. Obtenido de "rebote" a partir de un blundle hace un par de a√±os parec√≠a que este juego iba a ser uno de esos que se tienen y nunca se juegan. Sin embargo, tambi√©n sucede que a veces jugamos a algo "por probar" y nos quedamos maravillados. Este es el caso de este juego.

Beatbuddy es un juego que se desarrolla en un fondo marino donde tendremos que salvarlo de un malvado principe que quiere hacerse con la m√∫sica. El argumento es realmente trivial y queda en un segundo plano cuando comenzamos a jugar, ya que sin lugar a dudas lo m√°s destacable de este juego es su impresionante m√∫sica. 

Tal es as√≠ que mientras jugamos vamos acompa√±ando nuestros movimientos con la m√∫scia que suena, no porque nos obliguen, sino porque el ritmo es realmente excelente. M√∫sica funky, electr√≥nica y varias notas de jazz y blues hacen que desplazarnos por el fondo del mar sea realmente espectacular.

Su aspecto gr√°fico, por otro lado, es fabuloso. Es una aut√©ntica maravilla ver los paisajes, enemigos, y elementos que configuran los puzles para darse cuenta del gran trabajo que han realizado los desarrolladores. Colores vivos, din√°micos y con una gran personalidad.

En su aspecto puramente jugable, el juego es una mezcla de puzles, arcade y shoot 'em up, dependiendo del nivel, y todo, como es normal, ir√° complic√°ndose mientras m√°s avanzamos. A√∫n as√≠, su dificultad no es demasiado elevada, y aunque moriremos en numerosas ocasiones, hay gran cantidad de puntos de control que nos permitir√°n seguir cerca de donde lo dejamos.

El control, jugado con mando, es realmente fabuloso y responde perfectamente a las √≥rdenes dadas muy r√°pidamente, algo fundamental ya que muchas veces habr√° que pasar por recobecos en poco tiempo mientras nos persigue alg√∫n monstruo marino o un artilugio mortal.

La duraci√≥n del juego no es demasiado larga, unas 5-6 horas como mucho, y su rejugabilidad es bastante limitada, a no ser que volvamos a jugar por disfrutar de la m√∫sica nuevamente mientras jugamos. Este aspecto es el m√°s limitado del juego, pero la experiencia que te deja al acabarlo es muy positiva.

En resumen, Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians es una peque√±a maravilla que sin duda encantar√° a todos los amantes de la buena m√∫sica, los puzles y el arcade fren√©tico. Muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995349586', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1439137972}
review: Nach ca. 1,5 Std Spielzeit nehme ich mir die Freiheit ein Review zu schreiben. Beatbuddy ist eine sehr gelungene Mischung aus Musikspiel und Jump¬¥n Run (oder Jump¬¥n Swim?). Eine grafisch sehr liebevoll inszenierte Geschichte die uns die Welt der Beats f√ºhrt. Die Steuerung ist sehr simpel gehalten und der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist nicht sonderlich hoch aber das st√∂rt in keinster Weise, wodurch man das Spielerlebnis genie√üen kann. Die Story ist nett gemacht (m√∂chte aber nicht spoilern). Der Soundtrack ist wahnsinnig gut (selbst wenn man musikgeschmacklich eigentlich anders orientiert ist). Falls im Sale unbedingt zugreifen! Auch den Vollpreis absolut wert. Wer sich nicht sicher ist sollte einfach die Demo zocken.

review:
Extremely easy to end up with a checkpoint that leaves you 100% stuck, which means you need to restart the level from the begining if you want to progress. These kinds of bugs shouldn't be in a released product. The last update from the developers was well over a year ago, meaning it will most likely not be fixed.

Ruins an otherwise pretty cool game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993699776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1425791103}
review:
Gotta move with the rhythm!

Don't let the look fool you, this game is kinda tough! If you're good with timing your moves right, it may not be, but if you're a little impatient sometimes, it can turn into a really rough playthrough. That being said, it's a fun, challenging game with some cool little puzzles as a result. The story's not much to write home about, but the art style and music are the biggest highlights of this game. 

The developers managed to bring together a variety of musicians of all sorts (including Austin Wintory of Banner Saga and Journey fame), giving each level a nice, distinct beat to match the changing environments and increasing difficulty. Even more impressive is that the sound effects of the various objects in the game complement each song, making more challenging sections even more enjoyable as you experience the full form of the background track. 

The gameplay itself is pretty straightforward swimming about, grabbing objects to open doors, swiping at enemies to defeat them or to hit switches in the environment. However, much of it is interwoven with following the rhythm of certain obstacles to solve puzzles by fitting into enemy movements and/or creating openings in moving obstacles to roll with the flow to get further along. It's not hard to figure out, but getting it just right can take a few tries, and it's pretty clever design to match with the overall theme of music embedded in the game from the soundtrack to the land of Symphonia's own little mythos. 

If you want a lighthearted, charming experience, that doesn't over stay its welcome too long, I highly recommend checking this out. It's lots of fun, though I might recommend a controller. =)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999257796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1425336215}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053923250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1423344160}
review:
Very disapointing!!!! Starts off as a fun game but then the puzzles quickly become very tedious. Then we get to the Bugs. I'm not just talking about crashes and screen freezes here, i'm taking about bugs that force you to reset the entire level you are on and start all over!!!!! Frustrating!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I got as far as level 4 before deciding that my lifespan is far too short to deal with buggy trash like this game. The latest patches have also not helped repair the game either. I would recommend that you avoid!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052763893', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1423201481}
review:
The world of beatbuddy is based upon elecroswingish music. Various elements of the world "play" different instruments and so the level environment progressively increases or decreases the music as you progress. To interact with certain elemtns you have to keep up with the rhythm and time your actions right. At times there are labyrinths and logic puzzles to be solved.

Despite a few bugs my playthrough suffered on, which seem never to be fixed but could be found on google and worked around, it is a fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027141250', 'num_games_owned': 1727, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1422934578}
review:
This game looks like it could be a lot of fun, and it was fun at first, but eventually the puzzles became tedious rather than fun since you frequently have to navigate hazards with somewhat imprecise controls and the game ends up being fairly repetitive. It's not a terrible game, but it's starting to feel a bit like a chore to finish.

The biggest issues with the game however are the bugs. There have been several patches that have apparently fixed many of them, but I just ran into one that will require me to completely restart the level (the checkpoint save is bugged) and have to replay through several tedious puzzles again.

Until the developers actually properly fix the bugs so that players don't have to repeat already tedious sections of the game, I wouldn't recommend it at all, even if they're fixed I wouldn't recommend it at full price since it just wasn't that much fun for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092057843', 'num_games_owned': 1976, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1407895291}
review: Bons gr√°ficos 2D, boa jogabilidade e trilha sonora estupenda! Excelente jogo pra quem gosta de m√∫sica.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 869, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1421417743}
review:
[h1]Thats the Spirit![/h1]

Also Beatbuddy ist aus meiner Sicht wohl eines der besseren Indies, die man hier auf Steam findet. Es ist nicht ganz eine Indie Perle, wie ich es gerne nenne aber nahe dran.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Gameplaytechnisch bietet das Spiel einen angenehmen Aufbau. Der Spieler und Beatbuddy lernen nach und nach ein paar kleinere F√§higkeiten und auch Abwechslung ist geboten. Jedoch k√∂nnen einzelne Passagen doch recht langwierig werden und etwas Eint√∂nigkeit kommt auf. Jedes Level wird getauscht ob wir rumschwimmen oder mit dem Gef√§hrt fahren. Die R√§tsel sind durchaus machbar, manchmal musste ich ein wenig √ºberlegen aber im Grunde sind sie eher einfach. Genau wie die R√§tsel ist das Spiel relativ Casual gehalten: Gegner sind leicht zu erledigen und ich bin nicht oft gestorben, wobei dann auch die Checkpoints sehr angenehm gesetzt sind. Das Einzige, was man finden und sammeln kann, sind die Kristalle. Diese dienen aber nicht irgendwelchen Aufwertungen, sondern jeglich Freischaltungen von ein paar Bildern, wie das Spiel programmiert wurde. Waren auch nen paar lustige Bilder dabei ;)

[b]Story[/b]
Die Story ist eher m√§√üig bis schwach. Man wacht auf, trifft ein paar Charaktere (glaube 6 im ganzen Spiel) und es kommen nur wenig Dialoge. Die sind jedoch recht schlicht gehalten aber dennoch recht am√ºsant geschrieben. Aber die Story ist ja hier wieso nicht das Hauptaugenmerk.

[b]Musik[/b]
Die Musik ist wohl das Wichtigste an Beatbuddy. Viele Gegner und Gegenst√§ne im Spiel verursachen eigene Ger√§usche und dadurch kann man die Musik ein wenig kontrollieren. Zudem wechselt auch die Hauptmelodie des √∂fteren in den verschiedenen Kapiteln.

[b]Grafik[/b]
Die Grafik ist ungew√∂hnlich, gut und durch den "Zeichenstil" wirkt das Spiel wesentlich einladender und symphatischer.

[b]Fazit[/b] 
Leider ist Beatbuddy eher kurz geraten mit etwa 5 Stunden Spielzeit, man soll sogar laut Erfolg das Spiel innerhalb von 3 Stunden abschlie√üen k√∂nnen. Dennoch macht die Musik Laune und man Beatbuddy wunderbar relaxt mit einem Controller vom Sofa/Bett aus spielen. Es ist trotz der kurzen Spielzeit ein lustiges Spiel gewesen und ich kann es nur empfehlen :)

Ich habe Beatbuddy durchgespielt und ein spoilerfreies und noch ausf√ºhrlicheres Review auf meinen Youtube Kanal hochgeladen. Dort stelle ich generell mal gerne gute Indie Titel vor:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y5kfu6sLpiI
Alternativ kannst du, wenn dir das Review gefallen hat, auch [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool]meiner Kuratorgruppe auf Steam[/url] folgen, um meine Reviews auch zu anderen Spielen zu bekommen.

review: Good game at its core, but mouse controls are "spongy" which makes it very difficult to sync up to the music beat (a core aspect of the game). I encounted many game breaking bugs which forced me to give up mid-way through after the third complete restart. Fun, but not recommended in its current state as it's more a recipie in frustration due to the above than entertaining gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110862903', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1484939828}
review: Muito bom jogo, jogabilidade simples e bem elaborada, os ritmos musicais seguem conforme a a√ß√£o do personagem. Pra jogar e relaxar esse √© o jogo!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044351423', 'num_games_owned': 1137, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1421740678}
review: A very enjoyable Adventure-Puzzle game set underwater in a world of music and especially funk, swing and jazz, where everything moves to the beat. Enemies and puzzles are timed to the rhythm of the beat, creating some unique and enjoyable moments and game mechanics. The music is fantastic, the world is pretty and vibrant including some stylish character design and the game is light-hearted and great harmless fun. It is a casual, arcade-style game that does not take itself too seriously, yet there is a lot of content here, if not slightly repetitive in nature. Excellent game, one of my favourites so far. Highly recommended!
