author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 999, 'num_reviews': 685, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1420163803}
review: Suprisingly solid game, with just a few problems that bring it down. First off, the main character and his friend are awesome. Little things like leaving him to stand still prompt him to choose one of multiple dance moves that align to the beat, are a nice touch. There is some awesome music and having gameplay and mechanics align with the music and beat are a new and inventive touch. Some of the middle levels lose the quality music and just seem like opera music that doesn't really fit the level and the gameplay doesn't rely as much on it which is disappointing. Also multiple different beats and songs per level would have been better than just one. Problems are a lack of difference as levels, as each one looks and feels the exact same. Another problem is the game uses the same few puzzle, enemies, and game mechanics for the entire game, leading to way too much repeition. There are also numerous reported bugs, some of which you must restart the entire level over again for, such as I had to, which can lead to 20-30 minutes of lost time. Seeing as how the game has been out a while not as many bugs should persist as you see reported on the message boards. The ending is anticlimactic. More of the game should have been spent platforming/fighting enemies etc as opposed to just breaking barriers which bouncers and moving gateway triggers. The levels are big and have multiple branching paths which can be confusing because you have to spend way too much time solving similar puzzles. Some levels such as running from something, or guiding the way for someone, break up the monotony, but are too few and far between. I would there would have been more of those different type of levels. Each level boils down to using the ship and the guy, each of which feels like the last time you used them. Still a fun game and inventive way to incorporate music into it all. Also there is the cuteness factor. 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198071113436', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1402769163}
review:
"Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians" is a sweet music and beat based game. 

The level of adorableness of this game is too damn high. So let's take it from the top.

The environment is underwater. The beautifully made areas are hand painted, and filled with rock formations, plants, and cute sea creatures. It is all very pleasing to the eye, and generally forces me to smile throughout the whole experience. Also, the environment is not motionless, it is all vibrant, pulsating, bouncing, and swinging to the soundtrack.

The main character is called Beat Buddy. It's a small, blue, bubbly creature with big eyes, and... earphones. Whenever you stop to figure out a puzzle, he floats in the water bouncing his head and swinging his arm, like a real DJ. Did I mention it is adorable?

The game is basically an action-adventure with loads of puzzles, all focused around the music playing in the background. Each obstacle, element, creature has it's own unique sound which always incorporates nicely with the music, creating a beautiful, energetic soundtrack. From jazzy oldschool sounds, through clubby electronic, and even funky-rocky sounds.

While you can solve any puzzle and go through any obstacle without even turning the sound on, listetning to the soundtrack gives you an advantage. The beat, the sounds actually give you small tips and clues, when and how you should move to go through a challenge effortlessly.

The puzzles slowly progress from absolutely obvious to very complicated. It requires logical thinking, timing, and a good ear.

For me, the game is very relaxing. As I traverse the underwater environment, searching for my friends, hoping to save them.. as I bounce, float, punch my way through complicated labyrinths, I feel myself unwind. The music, the soft but vibrant colours, the sweet personality and feel of the game have a wonderful, positive impact on my mood.

So if you would like something gentle, soothing, and adorable. Something that will make you smile, but will still challenge your gaming skills, try "Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians". And don't forget to wear good headphones or turn your speakers up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996082709', 'num_games_owned': 1133, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1421206824}
review:
DISCLAIMER: Although I give this a reccomendation, do NOT buy this game at full price. No reason to pay that ammount for what you get. Wait for a sale.

Overall? 7/10

If there weren't game breaking bugs, I would most certainly give it an 8/10. A great sidescrolling puzzle/adventure game in the spirit of Donkey Kong under water levels. It's not perfect, nor is it the most in-depth puzzle scroller I have played, however... It's a beautifully executed casual game. The music is enjoyable to listen to, and (in my opinion) doesn't make you want to gouge your eyes out after listening to it for 10 minutes.

A lot of the controls/environment effects are themed, of course, around the beat of the music... and timing according to that. Though I don't think it adds anything particularly "unique" to the game, they implemented it well... and it fits in with the world and story.

Pros:
-Very beautiful game, the hand drawn environments added to my enjoyment.
-It's really fun. When you aren't stuck with a bug.
-Not entirely unique, but it puts a good focus on timing your movements with the beat of the music.

Neutral:
-Controls are a little looser than I would like when interacting with objects, not enough to be a con.
-Puzzles, they aren't too hard.. and they arent too difficult. Very casual. This could be a con or a pro.

Cons:
-Game breaking bugs.

EDIT: This isnt accurately refelcting my played time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978009802', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1395244659}
review:
It's a great blend of electroswing and other wonderful music with an interesting combination of puzzle and action gameplay. The art style with its bright colors is also easy on the eyes, but the music certainly is the game's strongest point. I terribly suck at music games, but here I kept bobbing my head to the rhythm here out of sheer enjoyment of the tunes. This, of course, helps a lot in playing as you benefit from doing certain actions within a rhythm.
But anybody entirely unable of keeping a steady rhythm needs not to fret either, as the game is rather forgiving.

If I had to criticize anything, it would be the fact that it's entirely possible to miss collectibles on your first trip through a stage. Take the wrong turn, and you can't go back. Sure, that's a minor complaint, but for a completionist like myself, it can be a bit jarring as you need to replay a stage at least once to grab all trinkets and possibly once more to finish a stage in as little time as possible for the "beat the game in under x hours" achievement.

Also, the controls feel wonky at times, but you get used to it, and in no time you'll swiftly sway though the ocean.

Still, it's an overall wonderful and quite unique experience that's well worth trying out not only for its great style.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993853495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1415048496}
review:
It's not an overall terrible game, but it is incredibly tedious. The puzzles are bland and after the first fifteen times you bounce off plants after aligning a couple drum-things, it gets rather boring. Plus I encountered game breaking bugs like when, during a chase scene in Chapter Two, I could not shoot through the pillars to escape the giant fish head. There was also the time my character disappeared from the screen entirely, and I had to restart the game. It does have a nice feature where, if your computer has changeable colored lights on the front, they will pulse and change color with the music and environment.

I did not finish this game, as I could not proceed past the aforementioned bug, and it was getting repetitive. Maybe the puzzles (and music) get more varied as you go on, but I don't feel compelled enough to find out.

C-
I felt this game had some interesting mechanics, but they weren't fleshed out enough. Plus, game stopping bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995554713', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1414972420}
review: Beatbuddy pairs great music and wonderful art with poor execution. I have encountered multiple bugs (Mac version) while playing and the controls can sometimes be a bit frustrating. The difficulty level swings abruptly between way too easy and maddeningly difficult pretty regularly, and it can sometimes be hard to tell if it's the software bugs or level design that causes it.

review: Ich fange nun einfach mal an. Das Spiel Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians ist ein sehr sch√∂nes Spiel Es geht wie man erahnen kann um Musik. Der Sound ist perfekt am Takt des Spieles angepasst und bietet abwechslungsreicher hochklassige Elektro-Soundtracks. Als Grafik wird uns super sch√∂ne handgezeichnete Welten pr√§sentiert und es ist sehr geschmeidig animiert und alles bewegt sich im Takt der Musik. Als negativ muss man dort anprangern das sich die Levelabschnitte zum Teil wiederholen. Die R√§tsel sind ansprechend aber nicht zu schwer aber auch nicht zu leicht und es wird kontinuierlich langsam schwerer. Sollte man ein Part nicht schaffen bzw sterben wird man nicht zu weit zur√ºck gesetzt. Also wer R√§tselspiele mag und elektronische Musik der macht hier im spiel nichts falsch

author: {'steamid': '76561198025582477', 'num_games_owned': 965, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1412858519}
review: This is a mostly good game. I read some of the reviews while playing it, and for a while I disagreed. I have a lower end computer, and for most of the game the fps was fine, which worked for me. I loved the music, and at first worried that I would get sick of hearing the same song for upwards of 45 minutes or so, but it was always just fine, seeing as how it would always play differently depending where in the level you are. The songs are fantastic, no doubt about that. The problems with the game are all in the final level. Many of the puzzling elements are quite forgiving, and moving around each level is relaxing a majority of the time. Not so for the final level. It was buggy (I ran into three bugs within a half-hour), ridiculously hard (most puzzles in the game I cleared on the first or second try, for the final level the last puzzle took me twenty minutes alone), and the game wraps up in a cliched ridden and unsatisfying way. It could have been so much better, had it been anything like the previous levels. The worst part is, it leaves you on a sour note. The last level makes me bring the game from a 9/10 to a 6.5/10. I still suggest you play the game. Just set your BS tolerance on high for the final level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997381526', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1457815524}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019157549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1393680324}
review:
(Linux Version reviewed)
For a game that advertises a great musical experience, it sure is devoid of music. ‚ÄúBeat Buddy‚Äù is actually an action-puzzle game, with a heavier emphasis on puzzles (and drums) than I was expecting. 

The production values are great, with slick, captivating graphics and smooth controls. But after an hour and a half of playing, I didn‚Äôt get to hear one song in the heavily-promoted soundtrack. All you‚Äôll hear are drums and cymbals, with an occasional snippet of sampled music. Basically, you‚Äôre listening to a drum machine for hours on end, which I found so irritating that it killed the game for me.

It‚Äôs a shame that the ‚Äúdrum machine‚Äù aspect ruins the game, because it‚Äôs otherwise a decent-enough game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009838085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1411228603}
review:
I know how hard it is to create a good game and I want to say out loud that this game made many things fine, but there is also plenty of bad things. 
I especially like the idea of merging and developing the game mechanics together with other aspects of the game (here only with music). It is my ideal approach to game design. You should play this game to see it. 
On the other hand game isn¬¥t fun. It is confusing in parts: beautiful paintings doesn¬¥t show you your way through in some places. Although it is kind of easy it fails to learn you something about the environment: like that beautiful yellow crystals are bad. They looks like purple/pink one but these will kill you. I had it on my mind, but I thought: don¬¥t be paranoid, just try it. New (and evil) things should be introduced more "spectacularly". 
Simply: play it to see new approach to game design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994271178', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1411414954}
review:
Hallo Indie-Game Freunde!

Meine Review zu Gamebudy:

Allgemeines:
Ihr spielt in einer Unterwasserwelt, in der die Musik alles beherrscht. Euren Charakter seht ihr hierbei in "Super Mario"-Manier von der Seite. 

Grafik:
Oft zurecht gelobt. Die Grafik von Beatbuddy ist wundersch√∂n designt und stimmungsvoll.

Die Musik:
Die Musik gef√§llt mir eigentlich recht gut. Leider habe ich das Gef√ºhl das das eigentliche Konzept, n√§mlich durch die Musik dem Spiel einen Rhytmus zu geben leicht verfehlt wurde. Oft wir der Flow der Musik durch irgend ein dummes R√§tsel unterbrochen.

Steuerung:
Habe ich in einigen Reviews als Minuspunkt gefunden. Ich selber bin mit der Steuerung sehr zufrieden. Man kann das Spiel auch einwandfrei mit einem Controller spielen.

Story:
Leider sehr √∂de. Die Story regt nicht wirklich zum spielen an. Es geht, wie so h√§ufig um die Rettung der Welt.

Spielspa√ü:
Langzeitmotivation bietet das Spiel eher nicht. Daf√ºr spiele ich es immer gerne wenn ich mal noch 20 Minuten Zeit habe. 

Pros&Cons:
+ Grafik
+ Steuerung
+ Spielspa√ü
- Konzept
- Story
- Schwierigkeitsgrad

FAQ:
Kann ich das Spiel mit Controller spielen?
- Ja!

Wie lange sitzt man an dem Spiel?
- Vielleicht 4 Stunden. Es hat 5 Level mit je 5 Kapiteln.

Was hast du gezahl?
- Ich hatte das Spiel in einem HumbleBundle. Ein guter Preis sind 2‚Ç¨.

Warum empfiehlst du das Spiel?
- Zum Einen: Die Entwickler sind schon sehr sympathisch. Sie haben ein paar Making-Of Bilder beigelegt und man merkt wie viel Herzblut in Beatbuddy steckt. Zum Zweiten: Es macht in kurzen sch√ºben immer wieder Spa√ü. 

Fazit:
Beatbuddy ist ein klasse Spiel f√ºr zwischendurch. Aber der Metascore von 75/100 ist schon gerechtfertigt.

Das Rhythmus basierende Gameplay h√§tte noch deutlich mehr Potenzial gehabt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066720916', 'num_games_owned': 1212, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1412270140}
review:
N√£o esperava muito deste jogo, mas depois de jogar por algumas horas j√° n√£o conseguia mais parar.
Cen√°rios coloridos com gr√°ficos lindos, m√∫sica (beatbox na maioria das vezes) divertida ao qual os "objetos" do cen√°rio seguem o ritmo e jogabilidade agrad√°vel (principalmente pelo controle de xbox).
Mas como nada na vida s√£o flores, encontrei muitos bugs...
* Ap√≥s "morrer" em certos momentos me tornei invulner√°vel e a tela ficava em tons de vermelho;
* Ap√≥s terminar um cen√°rio com o submarino, a pr√≥xima fase foi iniciada comigo ainda dentro;
Entre outros...
Em todos os momentos de bug tive que voltar para o √∫ltimo checkpoint =/

Enfim, apesar dos pesares... Jogo bem divertido e super recomendo.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198072012333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1410027853}
review: I want to like this game so much, awesome concept, fun music, but the gameplay just sucks. The levels go on for too long, making me sick of the song by the end of each level. The controls/level design feel sloppy/sluggish, there's no way to avoid bumping into stuff all the time, slowing down your progress and ruining the mood. The game also can't decide whether to focus on puzzles or platforming, neither of which are designed all that well. I could be asking too much, just finishing playing Rayman Origins, but this game just isn't well polished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000524957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1409762097}
review:
Beatbuddy is sort of a platformer, except intead of platforming, you swim around a 2D space solving a variety of simple traversal puzzles.

[h1]The Good[/h1]
[list]
[*]Excellent dynamic soundtrack
[*]Charming writing
[*]Some nice 2D visuals
[/list]

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
[list]
[*]Game scripting broke on multiple occasions, forcing me to restart the chapter from the level select menu. (Restarting from the last checkpoint wasn't sufficient.)
[*]Controls didn't always seem up to the gameplay tasks demanded
[/list]

On the whole, a nice surprise from the Humble Bundle, but perhaps not something worth seeking out on its own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026939898', 'num_games_owned': 1576, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1405922341}
review:
It was alright. I finished it. I got to a point in the game, where I thought, "alright, alright, I get it... I understand the concept of the game and I've gotten the hang of it, and now I am bored."

There's not a lot of enjoyment for me past that. I'd love to get more critical, but I feel like anything else I say is just rambling. The art is nice, and the story is goofy in an almost funny positive way.

overall: 4.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197975346768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1409026462}
review:
I wish I could select both yes/no. I will put down NO. NOT because the game is bad. NOT because it isn't fun. NOT because the graphics are pretty nifty. I am putting NO down because this game has TOO MANY GODDAMN BUGS! I've had to restart COUNTLESS levels because of the buggy game interaction. It's freakin' ridiculous. Like, at Chapter 4 of the hive, after narrowly escaping death, i get to the end point and... NOTHING HAPPENS?!??!?!?! What in the actual freight train is up with that?! I had to restart that whole chapter because of that. And, it's not the only chapter where this happens. When the game first introduces the option to turn on/off beats you get thrown into a world of fury with switches turning beats off and the beats NEVER TURNING BACK ON AGAIN. In my case... I had to restart the whole goddamn level, NOT just the chapter, but the WHOLE... DAMN... LEVEL...

It's enfuriating. But, once you get past that, it's a lot of fun and I'm still playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994527992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1408916213}
review:
I would really like to recommend Beatbuddy, but I just can't... at least, not fully. While it's got a lot going for it, I just can't get past how buggy it is. Although I did manage to complete it, it wasn't without some serious issues. Several times I got stuck in various ways that prevented further progress - sometimes it was a matter of a game event not triggering properly, and sometimes it was due to going some way the game wasn't expecting me to (apparently). I also encountered issues where the controls would just stop working for no reason. Restoring to the last checkpoint sometimes fixes the issue, but this is rarely the case. Most times, there is no choice but to start the level (or entire chapter) from scratch. Do you know how annoying it is to have 30-40 minutes of progress wiped out, have to start over again, and hope you don‚Äôt make the same game-breaking mistake again (whatever it was)? Let me tell you - it's really f%@*&g annoying. I ended up having to do that multiple times. And would you believe, as a final bug-ridden cherry on top, the very end of the game also glitched out on me as well? Well, believe it. So on top of all the other frustration I experienced just getting through the game, I didn‚Äôt even get to see the full conclusion of the story. 

Now, putting all of that aside, what‚Äôs actually good about Beatbuddy? Quite a bit, actually. The hand-drawn layered 2D graphics look great, the controls are responsive, the puzzles are generally well-designed, and the music is decent. And that‚Äôs a good thing, because the music plays a large part in the gameplay - the environment works in time with the beat of the music, requiring specific timing to pass obstacles or solve puzzles. The first couple of hours are great, as the basic mechanics are introduced. Unfortunately, it starts to lose its luster a little bit after that, as most of the subsequent puzzles are pretty much variations on things you‚Äôve already done several times. So you might start to get tired of it after a while (or maybe I was just burned out from having to replay several areas). I would estimate the overall playtime to be somewhere around 4-6 hours.

Overall, the game is not bad, and I enjoyed it while it was working properly. The frustration from all of the technical issues I had just ended up being too much for me to give it a full recommendation. If you enjoy action/puzzle sidescrollers, music-themed games, and/or games with pretty 2D artwork, it‚Äôs definitely worth a look. Just be aware of the potential issues. I suppose it could very well be possible that you'd encounter no glitches at all‚Ä¶ but I doubt it (several posts in the Steam forums seem to corroborate my experience). At the very least, don‚Äôt buy it at full price unless the developers hire more QA people and/or release a patch that fixes the game-breaking issues.

review: Music is awesome. Gameplay wise, the controls are laggy and unresponsive. Also the game had tons of bugs for me. I really wanted to finish it. I got to the last level. But then the game bugged out (again) and controls stopped working no matter if I reloaded the checkpoint or the whole game. Honestly you are better off just buying the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082571861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1408644796}
review: I can't recommend this game at full price.  Fun for the first couple levels, then gets tedious and repetitive.  Several level breaking bugs on the last couple levels of the game that require complete restarts, buggy controls (using xobx 360), final game breaking bug that doesn't fix even with restart on last level keeping me from being able to complete the story.  The soundtrack is good, along with the level backgrounds, and overall aesthetic but I found myself just trying to finish for the sake of finishing rather than because I was having fun.  Couple this with the numerous bugs I ran into and I can't justify $10.  Pick it up for $2-$3 or less to have a little fun.  Other than that save your money.  Mediocre at best.  3/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1408524418}
review:
An interesting platformer, with a novel-ish idea - building the platforming mechanics around the rhythm of the music. Most of the time, it works, although there are some boring stretches.
Also, the checkpoint system tries a bit too hard to be user friendly, and sometimes gets you into situations where you can't move on. As each level is segmented into 5 chapters, and you can restart them individually, it's not totally gamebreaking, but can be distressing.

All in all, I can recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037266539', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1408359138}
review:
Although lots of people think this puzzle game isn't hard at all and the music sometimes just become annoying while players stay in a scene for a long time, I would still recommend this game.
First of all, with the beat music here, I say the developer team has a good intention to make the undersea lively and they succeed. The scenes of undersea here aren't dark and quiet but lively and bright. The design of the stages with the concept of the beat sound from objects which are interative and those which aren't have their own styles.
Second, the puzzles here are simple. However, the standard about difficulty of puzzles is different based on players' different gaming experience and the experience they're seeking from thie game. To me, puzzle games don't have to be hard to challenge but simple to relax myself.So, in my opinion, if you don't want to beat it one day after playing several hours but just relax yourself by playing games, it's good for you, too.
Last but not least, the game will be around 2 bucks on sale, which is pretty cheap to get. If you're pretty sure that this game is your type or at least you won't hate this game, I would say it's worth the price with the hours you spend enjoying youself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989078276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1394889132}
review:
Ein niedliches kleines Indiegame, dass mich wirklich unterhalten hat. Es war allerdings sehr kurz wie die meisten Indiegames, die ich kenne. Die Story war nicht erstklassig, aber in Ordnung. Die musikalische Untermalung insbesondere mit den Beats und Rhythmen, die man teilweise nutzen muss, empfand ich als wirklich innovativ. Die Steuerung ist allerdings gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig.

Pros: 
- Grafik ist h√ºbsch
- Leveldesign (wenngleich die Level unheimlich gro√ü sind)
- Intro und Outro (diese "Sprache" fand ich super)
- Musik

Neutral:
- Story (war ok, aber nicht weltbewegend)
- Spielzeit (k√∂nnte l√§nger sein, allerdings f√ºr ein Indiegame nicht un√ºblich)
- Steuerung*

Cons:
- Steuerung*

* Ich kann mich nicht endg√ºltig entscheiden. Man schwimmt quasi in diesem Spiel wodurch die Steuerung verz√∂gert ist und die Figur auch gerne mal im Beat noch einen letzten Schwung nach vorne macht, obwohl man sie schon nicht mehr bewegt. Einerseits ist das nervt√∂tend und st√∂rt, weil es die Kontrolle verschlechtert. Andererseits passt es zur Athmosph√§re und Umgebung des Spiels.

Fazit: Wer sich mit der Steuerung arrangieren kann und 2D-Scroller mag, darf ruhig zugreifen. Ich bin nicht der gr√∂√üte Anh√§nger dieses Genres und hatte trotzdem meinen Spa√ü. Insbesondere im Angebot kann man nicht viel falsch machen und man unterst√ºtzt einen deutschen Indie-Entwickler.

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cuevwB7xROk] Weitere Impressionen [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197967625658', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1408650843}
review:
Ich hatte schonmal ein Video von Giga zu Beatbuddy gesehen, wurde w√§rmstens empfohlen und f√ºr Zweefuffzsch zugegriffen.
Beatbuddy spielt sich sehr smooth, tolles Gelegenheitsspiel f√ºr zwischendurch. Am besten zu vergleichen mit dem letzten Teil der Raymen Reihe, nur in Beatbuddy "schwimmen" wir quasi rum.
Die Musik, auch von bekannten Interpreten wie Parov Stelar, in Beatbuddy ist eine Mischung aus vorgefertigten Tracks Electro/Electroswing/Lounge und vielen Samples, die durch die verschiedenen Mechaniken/Monster/NPCs akutisch mit in die Melodie eingebunden werden. Da gibt es dann zum Beispiel die Snare-crabs - wie die klingen kann man sich denken oder wenn die Texte der NPCs erscheinen l√§uft ein, im Hintergrund passender, Beatbox. 
 
Ich bin kein gro√üer Fan von Puzzleplattformern, aber Beatbuddy kann ich nur empfehlen - dazu muss man sagen das es genau meinen Musikgeschmack trifft. :) 

Durch die teilweise auch recht schweren R√§tsel und der Tatsache, dass die Musik im Vordergrund steht bei diesem Spiel - muss man sich drauf einlassen - haben wir hier ein kleines Meisterwerk voller skurriler Charaktere. Kaufempehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126285338', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1418917902}
review: Un gioco incentrato sul ritmo, molto belle le ambientazioni e i vari livelli, per esempio delle rocce in primo piano e altre nel background, rendono il tutto molto molto fico. I livelli sono vari e simili ad un puzzle game. Molto bello

author: {'steamid': '76561198080045733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1407632184}
review:
Un plataformas en un ambiente acu√°tico en el cual el ritmo de la m√∫sica se convierte en el factor identitario de este t√≠tulo.

No lo recomiendo por las siguientes cuestiones:
> La narraci√≥n de la historia es mala. No llegas a implicarte.
> La m√∫sica, que al principio puede sorprender y resultar interesante, en breve se convierte en mon√≥tona e incluso algo molesta, sobre todo si te atascas en una zona.
> La jugabilidad es frustrante. Al desarrollarse en un mundo acu√°tico, nuestro personaje se "desliza" por la pantalla, por lo que la dificultad del juego radica en poder controlarlo.
> Los puzzles son muy, muy b√°sicos. Al final todo se basa en romper barreras, encontrar un artilugio para abrir la puerta o encontrar el pasadizo adecuado. No los llamar√≠a ni puzzles.

Lo √∫nico que me termina de llamar la atenci√≥n es el aspecto visual.

Si despu√©s de todo esto decides adquirir el juego, te recomendar√≠a que usaras un gamepad.
El uso rat√≥n es desesperante y la experiencia mejora un poco si utilizas el gamepad.

review: The art reminds me of Aquaria. It's a passable game. The best part is the music. Using a controller is better than the mouse. I didn't try keyboard. It's really easy to get caught on edges as you're trying to dash past the insta-kill guys so you'll have to replay the same bits several times before you can continue. I think the game tries to be a puzzle game, but there are no puzzles. It's more frustrating than fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999405918', 'num_games_owned': 1775, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1406920774}
review:
A nivel de escenarios y tal, el juego es precioso. Ese ambiente de fondo del mar, muy bonito.
La m√∫sica est√° bastante bien. Es una especie de electronica pero est√° hecha por tios m√°s o menos de renombre y se supone que se acompasa con cierta acciones, pero bueno, eso vamos a dejarlo de lado. La m√∫sica mola.
El dise√±o de niveles se ve bastante currado y bien hecho. Son puzzles son de varios tipos y bueno, digamos que bien.
Pero...los controles son un horror (Yo jugue con mando la mayoria del juego, con teclado y rat√≥n diria que era peor aun). Hay veces que responde mal, hay veces que vas contrareloj pero el bicho decide quedarse pegado a una pared, hay veces que de tu parte piden una precisi√≥n absoluta, pero es imposible precisar con un bicho que se mueve como quiere. No me entendais mal, se puede jugar, pero m√°s de una y dos veces estareis frustrados porque el control no responde del todo bien.
Luego, la historia. Se supone que hay unos toques de humor y la cosa es muy desenfadada, eso le viene bien, porque es completamente random, ni le hacia caso realmente.

A pesar de sus puntos flacos, un juego bastante disfrutable. Yo me lo pas√© en unas 6 horas, as√≠ que os da para varios dias.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961161813', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1406487588}
review:
Beatbuddy is a game that comes together musically, but in some gameplay areas falls short. For the first half hour roughly you'll learn what "Beat" can do and how the world works around him. There is some awkward, slightly whimsical story that surrounds everything but it's not always clear what is happening. 
Gameplay is derived from moving around fluidly while creatures and things in the world all move to a beat. This is where I say musically the game shines. At some points you get an almost Fantasia feeling as a selection of sea creatures all make their own music, animating to the beat of the tune for the environment.

The music itself is catchy and immersive. My favorite moments in the game was when I would transition from just playing as Beat to navigating the watercraft vehicle. When this transition occurs, the levels music transitions to a chorus of sorts, making the song pretty powerful.

Unfortunately with all the cool rythmn actions happening, this is where gameplay tends to become awkward or constricted. Often times you'll struggly to effeciently pick up the object you need without spamming the mouse button. It just isn't a clean action, and since it's used heavily, you'll have moments of pure frustration sadly.
Movement is fluid as I mentioned, which once you learn the small nuances is easily adaptable. I was able to navigate almost all regions with ease.

The overall game is good and worth a play certainly, if not just to experience the cool music and beautiful 2d art and subtle animations. They definitely maximized the use of Unity for this game and it shows nicely. The overall game will feel repetitive after Environment 3 imo, but it'll be an enjoyable experience nonetheless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972990074', 'num_games_owned': 3115, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1406495688}
review: If you play this game for about an hour, unfortunately you've already seen everything it has to offer. i'm still a few levels from the end but it is turning into a serious test of my patience to finish it up. It's too bad because i was really into it at the beginning and then I realized that there just isn't a lot going on beneath the nice graphics, decent soundtrack, and a pretty promising core idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005463499', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1406141807}
review:
f I only judged it for the art and soundtrack, I'd give it 8 ou of 10, as the hand drawn scenarios are really beautiful and rich and the soundtrack has some really nice beats, but we also have to consider the gameplay and other aspects of the game, so, I'll stick with a 6.

First of all, there's the  story.
In terms of plot you don't really have that much to start with. 
You're in symphonia, a world moved by rythm and music, that is provided by 3 "buddies", that wake up when there's any sort of crysis, and you are one of them, then it all gets a bit boring, as you are thrown in the midst of a story without knowing anything about any of the characters, other than there's this bad guy that want's to steal the rythm to himself, and thats pretty much it.
No side quests, no background stories, no explanations, you just start swimming towards you objective, because the dialogues say so. 
the ending is quite disappointing, as the game ends as abruptly as it started, and there are no answers in the end, is just a sort of "and our heroes did the job, until the next time"
You get rewards if you catch all the gems hidden in each level, but it's mostly sketches and artwork, so You haven't that much replay value in it as for the moment you end the game, you have no remaining objectives or bonus levels that justify replaying the same levels from which you wanted to leave as soon as possible.
then there's my main problem with this title. The gameplay.
You play mostly as buddy, but there's also some parts of certain levels where you control a ship, and shoot bigger enemies. I'll focus on the parts you play "by feet" as that's most of the game.
It's not that the gameplay is bad, is just plain old repetitive.
At first, it may seem compelling - i had it on my wishlist for a while, and even tried out the demo first - , swiming in a wonderful underwater-like world, exploring every corner and noticing how everything works along with the beat of the soundtrack. 
And then... you realize you've been listening the same song over and over and over for the whole level, and the past 2 levels. 
And that you've been doing the same thing repeatedly for hours - find a key or a switch, carry it to a gate, smash some shells blocking the way, hitting enemies, and repeat the process minutes later as you'll find a new closed door. You have some cool puzzles, but it's mostly the same sequence i described above.
 You have to do things with the rythm and if you're playing for a relaxing time, you may end up getting frustrated with a parasite you have to hit in a musical order, that you miss because you pressed the button a second too early.
In the end is a fun game, that can get boring a little too fast if you're playing it for the story, but still has a beautiful artwork and interesting soundtrack.So I just finished this one, and I just got the urge to review it.
If I only judged it for the art and soundtrack, I'd give it 8 ou of 10, as the hand drawn scenarios are really beautiful and rich and the soundtrack has some really nice beats, but we also have to consider the gameplay and other aspects of the game, so, I'll stick with a 6.

In terms of plot you don't really have that much to start with.

No side quests, no background stories, no explanations, you just start swimming towards you objective, because the dialogues say so. 
the ending is quite disappointing, as the game ends as abruptly as it started, and there are no answers in the end, is just a sort of "and our heroes did the job, until the next time"

You get rewards if you catch all the gems hidden in each level, but it's mostly sketches and artwork, so You haven't that much replay value in it as for the moment you end the game, you have no remaining objectives or bonus levels that justify replaying the same levels from which you wanted to leave as soon as possible.

You play mostly as buddy, but there's also some parts of certain levels where you control a ship, and shoot bigger enemies. I'll focus on the parts you play "by feet" as that's most of the game.
It's not that the gameplay is bad, is just plain old repetitive.

At first, it may seem compelling - i had it on my wishlist for a while, and even tried out the demo first - , swiming in a wonderful underwater-like world, exploring every corner and noticing how everything works along with the beat of the soundtrack. 
And then... you realize you've been listening the same song over and over and over for the whole level, and the past 2 levels. 

And that you've been doing the same thing repeatedly for hours - find a key or a switch, carry it to a gate, smash some shells 
blocking the way, hitting enemies, and repeat the process minutes later as you'll find a new closed door. You have some cool puzzles, but it's mostly the same sequence i described above.
 
You have to do things with the rythm and if you're playing for a relaxing time, you may end up getting frustrated with a parasite you have to hit in a musical order, that you miss because you pressed the button a second too early.


In the end is a fun game, that can get boring a little too fast if you're playing it for the story, but still has a beautiful artwork and interesting soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048808158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1405409263}
review:
Aquaria: the Musical!

More words? Okay. It's a puzzle game about finding your way through labrynth-style caverns and dealing with various timing based boundaries as well as some enemies. It's not a bad game by any stretch but within the first hour you will have a very good idea as to whether it is "your jam". The artwork is absolutely sublime but the gameplay is excessively repetitive and the controls can be quite unwieldy at times. The vehicle sections are particularly obnoxious but are thankfully beaten by force alone.

I would not buy this game on it's own. If it's in a bundle or extremely cheap on sale and it sounds appealing then you should give it a shot. It's a short and unique game: with even a little bit of patience you can probably finish it in about four hours and not feel robbed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013882641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1405963178}

L'id√©e est excellente, le jeu sympa, simplement dommage que ce soit un peu sous-exploit√© au final (les phases o√π on doit r√©ellement faire attention au rythme qui nous entoure sont trop rares) et que le gameplay soit un peu trop redondant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101919114', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1432118136}
review: I bought this game from Humble Weekly Bundle but haven't try it, just buy that bundle for nothing. But then it collides up my friend wants me to try this game. So I just try this, and get disappointed as expected. My friend claimed this is rhythmic adventure game, probably like 140 I've been already playing, and claimed that this game is much better because it has storyline. In fact it's not. This game [b]just attempted[/b] to be rhythmic, see how when sign just appears up and some beats beat out there. But whenever you've controlling, your movement or such, nothing seems to follow that attempt to be beat. Everything is just like click, then fly there. (It's actually swim here, though) Puzzles? Nope, they aren't, they are not unique and, not even a puzzle I can say. Things are just screw up. Trust me, do not try this, it won't be good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022742232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1402605878}
review:
Pros:
- Great soundtrack. You just can't stop your foot from tapping the floor while playing this game. I'm listening to Beatbuddy soundtrack even after finished the game
- Artwork looks very neat. Concept art and developer notes show us how much work you have to do for the beauty which Beatbuddy is.

Cons:
- Game is actually short. I don't know how long it takes to finish the game, but after you did you feel unpleased.
- Controls. I think best controls are with mouse only if your keyboard can't stand ghosting (for this game you often need to click 3 buttons at once). Mouse isn't great either, especially when you have to pick/drop an object...
- Big SnareMonsters or whatever they're called. Just hate those things. I got bumped by it many times by them. If you can avoid swimming with them, just do it or you'll get pissed.

Well, more cons than pros, but still I think this game is great and you should look forward into buying it when it comes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108183039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1404807000}
review:
The game had potential as a music puzzle type but it just fell flat.

The game has good visuals with almost no glitches and has good game mechanics (with a mouse anyways). There are two different modes: 1 with a vehicle and one with you moving around which offers a good change of pace once in a while so you don't get bored.

However, the puzzles are simply get the key to the door with increasingly complicated ways and are not that challenging. The soundtrack had its moments but the same 10 second loop gets ANNOYING after a while. There is a story there with something about taking over the music or something but its so underdevoloped that you basically can skip all of it. Also, its very short (I took my time and beat it in 6 hours). There are collectibles but I just basically gave that up realizing that all it had were extras.

Overall, it had potential but it lacked a good amount of challange. As a simple way to pass the time, not bad but you can do better.

review:
Che dire, potrebbe essere un gran bel gioco, ma presenta molti difetti e bug che a mio parere dovrebbero far abbassare il suo prezzo fino a 2 euro scarsi. 
Mi sento di sconsigliarlo per questi motivi:
- iniziando un livello a met√† dall'ultimo salvataggio spesso l'intero puzzle di gioco si bugga, le conchiglie che vanno a ritmo si fermano cos√¨ come tutti i mob del livello. Bisogna quindi ricominciare da capo il livello e diventa una rottura dopo poco tempo;
- considerati questi difetti che lo rendono ingiocabile, i produttori non lo hanno mai aggiornato a dovere con dei fix.
Non conpratelo al prezzo intero perch√® non ne vale la pena, aspettate i saldi, anche se un gioco quasi ingiocabile non dovrebbe neanche esistere sul mercato.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992801270', 'num_games_owned': 3933, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1405567120}
review:
EDIT:  Here is my amended review now that I beat the game (on Windows) - I left the original review at the bottom.

Turns out that Windows was the key to enjoying this game.  I loved the art style, the music was awesome, the level design was exceptionally well done especially considering how it could've been extremely easy to get lost (yet I never seemed to), the only issue I really had was the controls.  On the Mac side, the mouse controls were terrible and a 360 controller didn't function properly.  On the Windows side, everything worked great on the controller and it made the game enjoyable since the controls were so tight.  If you only have a Mac, avoid this game.  If you have a PC or dual boot (and have a good controller), it's absolutely worth a buy.


V.1 - I want to like this game.  The music seems cool, the art style is interesting and the concept is a fresh take on the genre, but technical problems (at least for the Mac version) are holding me back.  The game crashes more often than it runs and the menu navigates without fail via 360 controller, only to have none of the buttons work once actually in the game.  Mouse control feels supremely subpar compared to what a gamepad setup would allow.  I'll try this game again on the Windows side later, but as it stands now, I'd pass if on a Mac.

review: Beatbuddy √® un esempio di come rendere la musica protagonista di un gioco. Sei livelli contraddistinti ognuno da un brano musicale in cui il giocatore con i movimenti del personaggio contribuisce a farla evolvere, anche attraverso l'ambiente circostante, creando cos√¨ la colonna sonora. Non √® solo questo per√≤. C'√® una storia, ci sono ostacoli da superare c'√® un gameplay non troppo vario ma sempre bilanciato che tiene impegnati per 5-6 ore. Davvero originale e colorato da gustarsi un p√≤ per volta con spensieratezza.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021609267', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1403984735}
review:
Buona l'idea ma realizzata coi piedi, sono un amante del genere ma il gioco √® super ripetitivo e noioso e a volte frustante nonostante non sia difficile. Ci ho giocato due volte e la prima mi stavo letteralemnte addormentado sulla tastiera, potevano fare tutto decisamente meglio a cominciare dalla poverta di ide nei puzzle....poi la musica il punto forza di questo gioco √® sempre uguale c'e' una traccia sola per ogni livello i livelli sono 6 e durano 1 oretta circa...ascoltare lo stesso motivetto per un ora √® da spararsi.
Voto 3/10

review: Un petit jeu original √† la jouabilit√© de merde et extr√™mement chiant et r√©p√©titif. Le jeu est plut√¥t jolie, avec un bon travail sur le son √©videmment. Si de prime abord l'histoire est original, il ne se passe finalement rien, elle permet juste de ¬´¬†cr√©er¬†¬ª l'univers du jeu, avec un humour qui tombe √† plat je trouve. A la moindre intervention d'un personnage, on ne rie pas, c'est juste emmerdant et on zappe pour pouvoir continuer notre progression, le sc√©nario est parfaitement inint√©ressant. Le gameplay est tr√®s limit√©, on ne fait quasiment rien √† part faire avancer notre personnage, en rythme, plus ou moins, d√©placer des trucs pour rebondir, et se cogner/planter lamentablement dans le d√©cor, sans parler des clics foireux pour les interactions. Du coup on rush pour finir le jeu et basta¬†! On y reviendra certainement pas au vu de la m√©diocrit√© du premier run. En bref, des qualit√©s visuelle et sonore, encore que √ßa ne casse pas des briques, mais la jouabilit√© hasardeuse, la tr√®s grande r√©p√©titivit√© des niveaux, et l'ennuie profond, ne permet clairement pas du tout de le recommander.

review: I haven't played it for too long, but I can already say this game is amazing! review:
Beautiful art style, but as a game Beatbuddy is lacking. The movement is unique, but quite infuriating at times. Even though this is supposed to be a rhythm game, a lot of the player's movements do not sync in with the background music, especially when it concerns those nasty white octopus things.
I'd recommend this game to people with quite a lot of patience, and appreciate a game's aesthetics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072545540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1403299348}
review:
Beatbuddy es un juego de puzzles y acci√≥n -con componente musical en ocasiones aunque no tantas como parece insinuar- en el que manejamos una extra√±a criatura marina que debe rescatar a unas damiselas de las garras de un pr√≠ncipe malvado.

Vaya por delante que lo m√°s destacable del juego es el aspecto musical. Casi todo elemento del juego emite un sonido a tempo con la melodia del nivel correspondiente, lo que genera pasajes variables que no nos dejar√°n de sorprender. Los gr√°ficos de los decorados son tambi√©n de una calidad art√≠stica fuera de lo com√∫n, tanto que en conjunci√≥n con la m√∫sica convierten a este juego en una obra de arte jugable. La jugabilidad se basa en puzzles y partes de acci√≥n en las que es muy importante moverse con sentido del ritmo para superar los obst√°culos. Nada insalvable tampoco, es bastante accesible y est√° plagado de checkpoints, as√≠ que la mayor parte del juego ser√° un bello paseo por parajes de fantasia y m√∫sicas hipn√≥ticas. Algo bastante chulo es que si recogemos unas gemas que abundan en los niveles, desbloquearemos una cachonda galeria donde los programadores nos explican con mucho humor el largo y dur peregrinaje que supuso la creaci√≥n del juego, incluyendo numerosos bocetos del desarrollo. De veras, valen la pena.

¬øLo peor de Beatbuddy? Pues que tiene un gameplay interesante, pero pronto se acaban las novedades y todo empieza a ser una repetici√≥n c√≠clica de los mismos elementos barajados con mas mala leche. No pasa nada, no es tan largo como para echar de menos muchas mas cosas, pero llega un momento en que nos damos cuenta de que la idea no da mas de s√≠. De todos modos su valor es ser una propuesta diferente, refrescante y muy cuidada, y siempre es preferible sorprenderse ante un videojuego desconocido que volver a disparar al barril amarillo para que exploten los soldados que encontrareis en el 50% de los juegos que salen hoy en d√≠a.

review: What starts as a slightly interesting game mechanic soon becomes tiresome, then irritating. Personally i found the first level to be a turn off immediately, taking about 30 mins to complete. One level was enough. I have no wish to play this again and would no recommend it to anyone. ( unless ofcourse you are into monotony, irritating sounds, dodgy controls and questionable level length)

author: {'steamid': '76561198126998213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1402851737}
review:
Beatbuddy has a lot going for him - the visuals of an underwater world are beautiful, the electro swing/house/jazzy music is great and the the main thing, puzzles, are fun too. 
What's not so great is that in order to solve those puzzles you need to move in rhythm with the music which is next to impossible. Even if you manage to click to the beat, the game reacts a split second later - and that is exactly a split second too late.
And worse than that, there are several level-breaking bugs that either force you to repeat a chapter and lose all your crystals or repeat the whole level.

All in all though, I played the game until the end and mostly had fun with it, that's why I decided to recommend it.
Pick it up in a sale and enjoy the music!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053428792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1403316673}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001226220', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1393831497}
review:
On paper this game is amazing: a game set to the beat of music that is interactive, with different elements of the game contributing to the song? That sounds aweseome!
But in reality, the execution of this game is terrible at best. The music is great, the art style is amazing with 2D back and foregrounds mixed with 3D characters. The main feature that lets this game is exactly that, the game. The gameplay is sloppy and poorly executed, often you will find you must send input at an odd off-beat to the music, not exactly off-beat, but at a completely different timing. The levels within the game begin to become overly repetitive and mostly the music is never fully playing, with the small loops of songs only having one or two 'instruments' playing at any one time. This sort of dissociation with the environment creates a very unsatisfying experience, ending mostly in failure to complete a level in good time or simply a rage-quit.
Conclusively this is a great game, save for the gameplay elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982658491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1407304901}
review:
Want to know why you should play this game? Parov Stelar is track one in this music-based game.
Want to know why you should care about Parov Stelar? Google "catgroove", listen all the way through.
The trailer doesn't fully express how it feels to be in control while the beat plays out alongside.

The games biggest flaws are:
[list]
[*]Being short.
[*]Being repetitive after the 3rd chapter.
[*]The astoudingly horrible introductory cinematic. For your own sake, just skip it.
[/list]

Sadly, these are serious flaws. While I think Beatbuddy does deserve to be played, I would get it while on sale.

I'm sorry the game's title is so bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973535804', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1507471113}
review: Contrary to some negative reviews, I find this game quite pleasing with the premise of rhythm and beat ruling the game. Sure, it's not exactly a strict move-on-the-beat game like Audiosurf or DDR, but instead is an adventure in a world that was created by music. The fact you can move freely and miss the beats doesn't really ruin the experience for me - it is a free-movement game, of course. The world itself moves to its own rhythm and you can try to follow it, or not. Using mouse controls makes a world of difference to the experience in comparison to other schemes. The art style is vibrant, the music is fantastic and so far it's proven to be an experience worth experiencing. Good job to the developers and musicians on making a fun, yet incredibly groovy game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016195124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1505780573}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054347147', 'num_games_owned': 840, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1402603287}
review:
Un juego simple, donde jugaremos con Beatbuddy, este extra√±o personaje, que nos llevara a dar una vuelta por curioso y bonito mundo.

El juego tiene una mecanica simple, consiste principalmente en rebotar con el propio personaje, para ir abriendonos camino y poder seguir avanzando, y resolver puzzles, bastante sencillos (en algunas ocasiones la mecanica cambia ligeramente).

El aspecto artistico del juego es muy bonito, con un raro "3D" en los personajes (no se si se puede considerar 3D) y graficos 2D con distintas capas, haciendo que el mundo cobre vida por si mismo.

La banda sonora es muy buena, es casi el principal motivo por el que adquirir, jugar y disfrutar el juego. Es mas, el propio juego la aprovecha muy bien, jugando con ella a placer, haciendo que muchos de nuestros actos hagan cambiar la musica.

El juego no dura mucho, pero lo suficiente para el dinero que cuesta. 
Si te guste este tipo de juegos, lo mas probable es que no te lamentes del dinero que cuesta, pero recomiendo mas comprarlo en oferta, ya que es una experiencia extra√±a, que puede gustarte o no.

En definitiva, el juego no esta mal si quieres jugar de vez en cuando y no pasartelo muy rapido (ya que si asi lo quieres, puede parecer muy repetitivo, tanto la musica como la propia jugabilidad). 

Un juego recomendado para pasar el rato.

review:
Beatbuddy ist ein sehr h√ºbsches, kleines Indie-Game, dass man gut nebenbei Mal spielen kann. Man vertieft sich in die Musik der verschiedenen Levelabschnitten und l√§sst sich in der farbenfrohen Welt treiben. Die Story und Charakteren sind sehr witzig gestaltet, jedoch ist es mit seiner Spieldauer von 5 bis 6 Stunden relativ kurz (aber das ist in dem Genre ja √ºblich).
Mein Fazit: Wenig Geld, viel Spa√ü!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984600345', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1396618507}
review:
Uno pensaria que este es un juegazo con unos graficos muy cuidados y una experiencia diferente y novedosa, no estaria en el error per√≤ si que fallaria en pensar que este es un buen juego, y lo siento porque queria que me gustase per√≤ no.


El arte es muy bueno, tiene una gran calidad, per√≤ se hace repetitivo. Siempre hay los mismos enemigos, a partir del nivel 2 o asi i hata el final no se √±aade ningun conpte nuevo. Quan aburrido es eso? Pues muy muy aburrido.

El juego pretende ser un arcade, per√≤ termina siendo un platformero que requeire controles precisos, cuando los controles dan pena, te frustrant porque dan la sensacion de estar controlando un airbus en lugar de un ser mitico que vivo bajo el agua.

Los puzzles son siempre iguales, i cuando no s√≥n mas que obtusos, sin explicaciones ni nada.

Lo mejor del juego √©s la musica, per√≤ cuando lelvas atascado en la misma seccion unos minutos i la seccion de la cancion se repite una y otra vez, solo quieres que termine y quiarte de en medio esa pesada cancion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971628333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1401861614}
review:
[b]Level breaking bugs and mediocre gameplay tarnish Beatbuddy's beautiful sights and sounds.[/b]

Beatbuddy's concept of fusing catchy music with puzzle/adventure gameplay is an appealing one. At first glance it looks like Beatbuddy does a good job of bringing that concept into reality. Unfortunately that just isn't so.

On the 3rd of 6 levels I ran into not one, but two different level breaking bugs that required a restart from the beginning of the stage. Exiting to the menu and continuing from last checkpoint did not fix either problem. I stopped playing the game after that. Normally I would persevere through these kind of issues but this brings up Beatbuddy's other fatal flaw: it's not fun to play.

At its core Beatbuddy is a pretty simple 2D exploration game. The environment moves to the music but your character does not. That detachment from the beat makes playing the game feel like any other average 2D adventure game. Couple that with collectable shards that are completely worthless unless you get every single one within a level (e.g., 411/412 won't cut it!) and you're in for a ho-hum experience.

Don't let Beatbuddy's snazzy soundtrack and visuals fool you; save yourself some time and money by just listening to the soundtrack on YouTube.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008616290', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1415007383}
review:
[i][b]A shame games cannot be reviewed just for their art.[/i][/b][/i]

Beatbuddy is a 2D exploration game with the whole game universe based on Music. The presentation is really creative, and the art original. The worlds are varied (with the exception of enemies only two in the entire game...) the Musc is very enjoyable and the fact that it builds up as you explore further gives a really gratifying feeling.

However while the artsy part of the game is great, the "Game" part really doesn't keep up.
For starters the narator has a tendency to mimic DJ scratching when he speaks. While it is a very interesting idea the result of it are cutscenes that are painfully long because of him, delaying any sense of conclusion at each and every sentence. Thank god they appear only rarely in the game.
The whole game is underwater which makes it impossible to have granular control. You'll often find yourself restarting mutiple times parts where very precise tasks are required to be done in very little time. Furthermore as you don't gain short invulnerability when hit and enemies love to push you around when they hit you [i]will[/i] find yourself being bounced about to your inevitable death. This happenning quite often it is one of the main reason while you will start cursing the game for not being forgiving.
Level design is not very well thought out either, you will often find yourself trying to find out why you can't go there, if you are actually supposed to be there and stuck because you went somewhere you weren't supposed to be.
All these issues lead to a hot mess of frustration and anger, powerless against a game that punishes you for being to curious.
And it really is a shame that the actual gameplay is the worst part of the game, leaving what otherwise would've been a enjoyable experiment.

Even though BeatBuddy has the looks of a fun rythm/exploration game, it's faulty game mechanics and ill conceived levels put an swift end to any enjoyable experience. Therefore I cannot recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067376120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1400857952}

I admit some parts were hard and annoying for me, because I couldn't time my moves right (hey, who doesn't like challenges?), but nevertheless I really enjoyed playing the game and would totally recommend it!

Buy it and go beat it with the beat ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014163253', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1462659880}
review:
[b][u]-Quick Review-[/u][/b]
Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians is a short indie game that has emphasis on music quality. The music style is closer to electric, beatbox, and dubstep.  (Sorry dubstep fans, I didn‚Äôt hear any wub wub wub) The gameplay itself was more focused on solving puzzles. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4u7hb9yM6ug
[b][u]-Detailed breakdown review-[/u][/b]
[b]Story:[/b] There are two cinematic throughout the game, the beginning video and ending video, you  are the character ‚Äúbeat‚Äù who has been awoken from his sleep and must save the other two guardians and go back to sleep. The guardians are the ones who create the music for the world, so it‚Äôs of the utmost importance that they all go back to sleep soon.

[b]Game Play:[/b] The game itself plays to the music, everything is done in rhythm, if you‚Äôre boosting, you need to do it in rhythm, if you‚Äôre hitting a parasite, it‚Äôs in rhythm. There are two ‚Äúplay modes‚Äù that you experience in the game, one in a ‚Äúbeatbuggie‚Äù where you‚Äôre in a vehicle that bounces along to the music on its own, the other is when you‚Äôre just swimming through the water as Beat.
As I indicated in my quick review, the game is quite focused on the music quality, and but to me the gameplay was focused on rather simple fun puzzles. I had been playing the game A Virus Named TOM for the past week, so the puzzles were very simple and relaxed compared to my earlier game.

[b]Achievements:[/b] First time playing through I got the majority of the achievements (this pleases me, I want to get through my indie games sometime this year) There are the notorious ‚Äúspeed run the game‚Äù and ‚Äúcollect all the things‚Äù  achievements, but as a whole most of the achievements you will earn simply by playing through the game once.

[b]Price:[/b] Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians costs $9.99, that‚Äôs a consistent price for indie games on steam apparently, I‚Äôd suggest waiting for a steam sale, or purchase the game in a humble bundle. I noticed there is also a demo you can download and test out. As always; if you‚Äôre really interested in getting a game, checking out a demo is always a smart way to go.
For me on my personal value system (price divided by time equals value) I only played 5 hours of the game until I had It completely beaten, I do intend to go back and try to get tougher achievements, however 5 hours of entertainment for $9.99 would be too hefty for me. For most other people though, that‚Äôs a perfectly reasonable price.

 [b]Conclusion:[/b] I really enjoyed this game, I found myself bobbing my head with the music as my character dodged with the music. I would recommend this game to anyone who really wants to play a game with A) Great music B) A beat-based music Game.

------Edits and updates------
Edit/Update May 26, 2015:
Added a link to my updated version of the review -- my YouTube video!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972651647', 'num_games_owned': 1545, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1396723276}
review:
This game is a swimmy platformer that excels at the gimmick of synchronizing environmental mechanics and hazards with the syncopation of the techno soundtrack. The music is great, the graphics are sharp and beautiful, and the engine is responsive with excellent player control. Other than the music gimmick it's a pretty run-of-the-mill platformer that doesn't seem to do anything other games in the genre haven't before. As such, I've played the first area twice and may never play more than that, but it was totally worth the price for just that brief experience. 

One of the hardest things to do is to meaningfully synchronize gameplay with music and Beatbuddy does it better than just about any other game. It's obviously a lovingly polished game made by lovers of dance music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096318819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1399503231}
review:
While I found the trailer and reviews intriguing enough to try it, also given that I'm a fan of many music games and platformers I gave it a try. But my opinion is that too easy, the gameplay is way to repetitive only getting a bit interesting late game, and a lot of the difficulty, when it is there, is more due to annoying, imprecise/unpredictable controls, combined with high requirements exactly for precision. I tried both mouse and keyboard controls, both of which didn't work all that well.

I also got stuck a couple of times, one time where I had to restart the level, and others that fixed themselves ultimately.

That said, it is visually beautiful, music is so-so, story is a bit boring IMO. I DID play it until completion, but maybe after the second level it was more about finishing than having fun, and then the fun returned a bit because the puzzles changed towards the end. I would probably rate it 2/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003135243', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1399319191}
review:
A labyrint game. Enemies and enviroment moves to the beat. The music in the game plays differently depending on the monsters and objects in range. That was a cool feature for about a minute, but the result of it is that you only hear a bassdrum most of the time when you play, and almost never hear the entire tune with all instruments, which is a bit boring.

The gameplay itself mainly consists of finding the correct path and once in a while pressing a button to the beat and solve some simple puzzles where you spin bouncing things so you can bounce your way to the next path. The story is boring.

I thought I would like this game, since I often enjoy music games, but I didn't enjoy it at all. I have played about 2 hours of the game. It was very easy during this time. I will probably never play it again because it felt like a waste of time playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960605591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1399102389}
review:
The puzzles are fairly easy, checkpoints and health are plentiful, and the story is a bit meh.

But who cares, this game is FUN.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054806568', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1431058488}
review:
I enjoyed playing this game very much! So much that I am writing my first review about a game. 

This type of game is meant to make the player use the clever beats and rhythms the designers implemented to go along with the level environment. BE the Beatbuddy! The art was very pleasing to the eye and the color elements in each level had its own distinct flavor that added to the game's unique nature. When I thought the game showed everything it had, something would always surprise me and that's one of the things that kept the game interesting. 

I highly recommend it for those players who like games for their art, music, platformer and puzzle/problem solving elements a game offers. Great game. It kept me busy for some time. Don't zip through the levels, just take your time and really take in the hard work the makers put into it. Aside from art work and music, the puzzles were fun and there were parts that were quite challenging. 

Oh! One more thing of course. The extras that are given really make you appreciate the game that much more. It tells you the story of how they made the game. And as you play on and collect the pink shards, you get more extras and it was really neat seeing how the game progressed. Again great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065364681', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1402127009}
review: WOW !! amazing soundtrack game.. HEADSET REQUIRED !

author: {'steamid': '76561198089007720', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1398600094}
review:
Beatbuddy is a really lovely little adventure game which combines good old platform/puzzle mechanics with a really cool rhythmic aspect that will keep you jigging along as you play.  It's been said a million times, but the soundtrack to this game is amazing (and I'll probably be buying it next chance I get).  The graphics and general atmosphere are really nice to look at, and it's clear that a great deal of care went into the game design.  The story isn't particularly groundbreaking; it's tongue-in-cheek, really, but the most important aspect of Beatbuddy is gameplay, which does not disappoint.  It is a rather short game, but the behind the scenes extras give it some replay value.

TLDR: It's short, but fun and pretty to look at with a great soundtrack.  Despite getting this game in a bundle, I would have gladly paid full price for it had I known how good it was.

EDIT: Thought I should add that I used a gamepad, and had no issues, didn't need to remap, etc.  Just worked straight out of the box, so to speak.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112374007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1401067007}
review:

gameplay is not too difficult, but also not easy enough to be boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030735248', 'num_games_owned': 1533, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1451544753}
review:
Rez is a rhythm-based game. This is not. 

I can only figure that this game is coasting on its "indies....support the indies!" status that tends to make people judge it less harshly. It reminds me of a less-fun version of Aquaria. In fact, I'd almost call it a blatant Aquaria knockoff.

I got it with one of those bundles that has mostly shovelware in it, though, so go figure. I would pass on this unless you like uninspired platforming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073309911', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1398349383}
review:
Beatbuddy is what the title says its got a Beat with rhythm and the main controls is by using the mouse . Often times , its frustrating when using the mouse but I understand  this is the best way . 

Often times the environment reacts by the beat of the soundtrack during that specific level and you have to follow the beat through various obsticles . Sadly I use quite little of it just to get through certain platforms . Beatbuddy is a cute little game with a story that I could not delve myself into cuz the characters literally beatbox when they talk and MY GOD i rather hear them Beatboxing then actually making dialog .  Overall , its a different kind of rhythm with platforming mechanics I give it 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198023476291', 'num_games_owned': 2073, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1394166748}
review:
(Originally posted March 6 2014)

Tried to give Beatbuddy a try tonight (no, that statement is not redundant), but gave up after about 10-15 minutes (and very little of that was spent actually "playing"). I got this in a recent Humble Bundle (I didn't buy this game specifically), and a music/rhythm action‚Äìadventure game isn't really my thing, but I thought I'd give it a try‚Ä¶

First off, this game is intended to be played with a gamepad (not mouse or keyboard), but gamepad support was‚Ä¶"not great", in my experience. Buttons on my Xbox 360 controller didn't map automatically, and try as I might, I couldn't GET them to map. I tried both mouse and keyboard controls, and they were both terrible.

As for the game itself, aside from an intro where the narrator was using such an annoying vocal affectation that it provoking me to feel an inclination towards physical violence‚Ä¶ I'll just say that the gameplay wasn't my "thing". I might possibly have given it a bit longer had I actually been able to use my gamepad, but at this point my patience was wearing a bit thin. Too bad, Beatbuddy‚Äîno recommendation from me!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025153641', 'num_games_owned': 947, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1393597962}
review:
this game has nice music and looks good and the concept is really cool. You follow the music and go with the beat. It doesn't work out well. 

The best parts of the game are with the vehicle since the beat part of the game is actually working and the music is usually at full blast there. Till then you usually have to solve really dull puzzles. (Imagine doing mirror puzzles from Zelda, but you get those puzzles CONSTANTLY.) and when you're not in the vehicle part, the music is really really slow and just not there. You're expected to follow the beat, but the Beatbuddy thing doesn't really follow it at all. 

If this game could be JUST vehicle stuff, I'd be able to recommend it. It would be good enough. But as it is, even 2.50? I don't think so. It's too much dull work to get into the kind of good parts of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071706064', 'num_games_owned': 1960, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1682795971}
review:
This game is worth it for the soundtrack alone, but beyond that it's actually a great game in its own right. I won't lie this game has it's odd little problems, at one point I got stuck on some scenery and toward the end of the game some of the scenery actually started to disappear.

Beatbuddy is a rhythmic platform puzzle game... Of sorts. The thing is the game world is, presumably, underwater. So your character (and all others) swim, so it's not like you jump, making the platform part kind of moot. I say it's a rhythmic game because the entire world runs to a beat, each level has it's own song, sadly there aren't many levels. Within each level are several puzzles which, of course, you have to do to progress.

In honesty I think I spent most of this game just listening to the  soundtrack.
